member.summary: The Job Entry service.

member.name: M:Erp.Contracts.JobEntrySvcContract.AddOperation(System.Guid,System.String,System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: THIS METHOD NEEDS TO BE PUBLIC - CALLED FROM bo/Project/Project.p

member.name: M:Erp.Contracts.JobEntrySvcContract.AddRefDesRange(System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.String,Erp.Tablesets.JobEntryTableset@)
member.summary: Creates new JobMtlRefDes records based on the JobMtl dataset fields.
member.param: The Prefix to be used to create Reference Designators
The Starting Number to create Reference Designators
The Ending Number to create Reference Designators
The Suffix to be used to create Reference Designators

member.name: M:Erp.Contracts.JobEntrySvcContract.AllowJobCosts
member.summary: This method exists solely for the purpose of allowing security for unchecking the AllowJobCosts flag

member.name: M:Erp.Contracts.JobEntrySvcContract.AppendDetails(Erp.Tablesets.JbAppendTableset,System.String,System.Int32,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.String@)
member.summary: This method takes the records built in BuildAppendDetails that are marked as append and writes them to the database. It will return the updated dataset.
member.param: Indicates where the details are being appended from. Either Quote, Job or Method
Unique key field one for Quote or Method source
Unique key field two for Quote or Method source
Unique key field three for Method source (is blank for quote source)
Returns a message listing any parts in error

member.name: M:Erp.Contracts.JobEntrySvcContract.BuildAppendDetails(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Int32,System.DateTime)
member.summary: This method returns the information that can be appened for approval
member.param: Source of the append details, Quote, Job or Method
Due Date to calculate V_AsOfDate and grac correct revision on Append Details.

member.name: M:Erp.Contracts.JobEntrySvcContract.BuildWhseLinkList(System.Guid,System.String@,Erp.Tablesets.JobEntryTableset)
member.summary: This methods builds a list of linked warehouses for the jobprod records.
member.param: The rowid of the JobProd record to build the warehouses for

member.name: M:Erp.Contracts.JobEntrySvcContract.CopyValuesOrderJob(System.String)
member.summary: If the job is linked to an order with a configuration, and the AllowReconfig is true for the JobHead target entity, copy the values from the order to the job if the user is reconfiguring.
member.param: The job number to create the jobprod for

member.name: M:Erp.Contracts.JobEntrySvcContract.CalcJobMtlEstMtlBurUnitCost(Erp.Tablesets.JobEntryTableset@)
member.summary: This method updates the calculation for the Estimated Material Burden Unit Cost, (JobMtl.EstMtlBurUnitCost) field.

member.name: M:Erp.Contracts.JobEntrySvcContract.ChangeEquipID(System.String,Erp.Tablesets.JobEntryTableset@)
member.summary: This method should be invoked when the Equip ID changes. Validates the EQUIPID and refreshes linked fields.

member.name: M:Erp.Contracts.JobEntrySvcContract.ChangeIssueTopics(System.String,Erp.Tablesets.JobEntryTableset@)
member.summary: This method should be invoked when the IssueTopics changes. Validates and sets the individual IssueTopic fields.

member.name: M:Erp.Contracts.JobEntrySvcContract.ChangeJobAsmblDirect(Erp.Tablesets.JobEntryTableset)
member.summary: This method is called when the user has changed the JobAsmbl.Direct field. This methods is currently not working. This method needs to check for a remote warehouse, if errors then set the JobAsmbl.Direct flag to true and then set the warehouse.

member.name: M:Erp.Contracts.JobEntrySvcContract.ChangeJobAsmblEstSplitCosts(Erp.Tablesets.JobEntryTableset@)
member.summary: This method calculates the Estimated Unit Cost and Material Burden Unit Cost. This method is called when the user has changed one of the Unit Cost Breakdown fields: JobAsmbl.EstMtlUnitCost/EstLbrUnitCost/EstBurUnitCost/EstSubUnitCost.

SysRowID (used only after multiple match resolved)

XRef Part Type (used only after multiple match resolved)
Potential message to return, will be blank
Returned flag stating if substitutes exist for this part

Type of message returned. Values can be; "Question" (asking if they want to use the substitute part) "Warning" (Warns them that a part is onhold or runout). The rowid of subcontract operation to check.
The rowid of the demand link to check.

SysRowID (used only after multiple match resolved)
Skip part xref jobhead field update logic (true for asm and mtl)
XRef Part Number (used only after multiple match resolved)
XRef Part Type (used only after multiple match resolved)
Potential message to return, will be blank
Returned flag stating if substitutes exist for this part

Type of message returned. Values can be; "Question" (asking if they want to use the substitute part) "Warning" (Warns them that a part is onhold or runout). "Error" (Part in Inactive, or Onhold/Runout parts are not accepted in this case) . "Question" is asking if they want to use the substitute part.

member.name: M:Erp.Contracts.JobEntrySvcContract.CheckTotProdQty(System.String,System.String,System.Decimal,System.String@)
member.summary: This method checks the total production quantity and returns messages if conditions exist and the returned message will contain 'do you want to continue?'. Depending on how/where it is called, the ipJobNum may be blank and the ipQuantity may be zero. Job Entry calls this on "changing" of the Engineered flag to true. In this case it passes the ipQuantity is zero since the jobs production demands are already known. During Job Manager, Create Job the ipJobNum is blank, but the ipQuantity of the demand is passed since this demand is yet in the job.
member.param: The quantity of the new Demand being added.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbMtlAppRow.Company
member.summary: Company Identifier.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbMtlAppRow.JobComplete
member.summary: Indicates if "Job" is complete. This is a mirror image of JobHead.Complete. Not directly maintainable. When the Job is completed, then all JobMtl records are also marked. This is used to make database access to open material records more efficient.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbMtlAppRow.IssuedComplete
member.summary: Indicates if this material requirement has been issued complete. If "yes" then this record is NOT part of the Part.AllocQty total even if it had been issued less than the original required quantity. The user may toggle the setting if the JobHead.Complete is "NO". When it is toggled the allocation logic will be triggered if necessary.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbMtlAppRow.JobNum
member.summary: Job Number.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbMtlAppRow.AssemblySeq
member.summary: Assembly sequence number that this material is associated with.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbMtlAppRow.MtlSeq
member.summary: A sequence number that uniquely defines the Material (JobMtl) record within a specific Job/Assembly. This is system assigned. The next available number is determined by reading last JobMtl record on the Job/Assembly and then adding ten to it.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbMtlAppRow.PartNum
member.summary: Part number. If the material is being purchased (JobMtl.BuyIt = yes) this does need to be a valid part in the Part file.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbMtlAppRow.Description
member.summary: A description of the material.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbMtlAppRow.QtyPer
member.summary: Quantity per parent. Field Service was EstQty in FSCallMt.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbMtlAppRow.RequiredQty
member.summary: Required Quantity per END ITEM. This is a calculated field. Calculated as (Parent Required Qty X QtyPer) + calculated Scrap. The parent quantity is either the JobHead.ProdQty if JobMtl.AssemblySeq = 0 or (JobAsmbl.RequireQty - JobAsmbl.PullQty) if JobMtl.AssemblySeq > 0.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbMtlAppRow.IUM
member.summary: Internal unit of measure. The unit used to measure the material.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbMtlAppRow.LeadTime
member.summary: Expected purchasing lead time (in days). This field is only valid if JobMtl.BuyIt = yes. This can be used to calculate a suggested "Order By Date" based off the Required Date field. When scheduling the job, purchased material can push a schedule out if the material lead time prevents the material from being available when the operation could start.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbMtlAppRow.RelatedOperation
member.summary: A material record can be related to a specific operation. This field contains the JobOper.OprSeq of the operation that it is related to. It can be left as zero meaning that this material is required at the very beginning of the production job. The related operation is also used to calculate the JobMtl.ReqDate based on the operations scheduled start date and materials lead time.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbMtlAppRow.MtlBurRate
member.summary: The material burden rate for this Job Material.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbMtlAppRow.EstMtlBurUnitCost
member.summary: Estimated Material Burden Unit Cost of the material. Defaults from the Part table if valid PartNum.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbMtlAppRow.EstUnitCost
member.summary: Estimated Unit Cost of the material. Defaults from the Part table if valid PartNum.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbMtlAppRow.IssuedQty
member.summary: This quantity is a summary of all Issue Transactions. For FS this was FSCallMt.ActQty

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbMtlAppRow.TotalCost
member.summary: Total cost to date. A summary of issue transactions. This DOES NOT include the salvageable scrap credit amounts. FS - was UnitCost in FSCallMt

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbMtlAppRow.MtlBurCost
member.summary: Total Material Burden cost to date. A summary of issue transactions. This DOES NOT include the salvageable scrap credit amounts.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbMtlAppRow.ReqDate
member.summary: Mirror image of related operation (JobOper) or assembly (JobAsmbl) Start Date. (system maintained)

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbMtlAppRow.WarehouseCode
member.summary: The warehouse that the material is allocated against.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbMtlAppRow.SalvagePartNum
member.summary: Part number for salvageable scrap from this material record. An optional field. This does not have to be valid in the Part master. Salvage info is mainly to allow the credit back to a job for this type of scrap via salvage receipt process.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbMtlAppRow.SalvageDescription
member.summary: Description of Salvageable material. Use Part.Description for a default.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbMtlAppRow.SalvageQtyPer
member.summary: A factor that multiplied by the JobMtl.RequiredQty results in the expected total salvage quantity.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbMtlAppRow.SalvageUM
member.summary: Default unit of measure for the Salvaged Part. Default from the Part.IUM.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbMtlAppRow.SalvageMtlBurRate
member.summary: The salvage material burden rate for this Job Material.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbMtlAppRow.SalvageUnitCredit
member.summary: Estimated Salvage Unit Credit. Use the appropriate cost from the Part master as a default.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbMtlAppRow.SalvageEstMtlBurUnitCredit
member.summary: Estimated Salvage Mtl burden Unit Credit. Use the appropriate cost from the Part master as a default.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbMtlAppRow.SalvageQtyToDate
member.summary: This quantity is a summary of all transactions for receipt of salvage to inventory. This is not directly maintainable.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbMtlAppRow.SalvageCredit
member.summary: Total salvage credit to date. A summary of salvage receipt transactions.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbMtlAppRow.SalvageMtlBurCredit
member.summary: Total salvage Mtl Burden credit to date. A summary of salvage receipt transactions.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbMtlAppRow.MfgComment
member.summary: Comments for manufacturing about this material record. These comments are printed on manufacturing reports, such as the router. For valid Parts use the Part.MfgComment as a default. View as editor widget.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbMtlAppRow.VendorNum
member.summary: Used to identify a default vendor. Use the Part.VendorNum as a default. This will be used as a default for purchasing and miscellaneous receipts. This field is not directly maintainable, instead its assigned by having the user either entering the "VendorID" and then finding the VendorNum in the Vendor file or by selection list processing. An optional field, but if entered must be valid.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbMtlAppRow.PurPoint
member.summary: The Vendors Purchase Point ID. Along with the VendorNum is used to tie back to the VendorPP master file. Use the default purchase point defined in the Vendor file.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbMtlAppRow.BuyIt
member.summary: Indicates if this material is to be purchased for the Job. If this is a non inventory part then this is "Yes" and cannot be changed. If this is a valid Part then set it to "NO" but the user can override it. Material that is marked to be purchased (BuyIt = Yes) are NOT included in the PartWhse.AllocatedQty.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbMtlAppRow.Ordered
member.summary: FUTURE IMPLEMENTATION. This logical relates to material that is flagged to be purchased (BuyIt = Yes). When purchase orders are created for this job material requirement this flag is set to Yes indicating that a purchase order has been placed. The idea would be to use this within purchasing to quickly see the "direct job requirements" where no purchase orders have been placed.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbMtlAppRow.PurComment
member.summary: Comments for purchasing about this material record on this job. These comments will be used as defaults to the PODetail.Comment field when the purchase order references this JobMtl record. View as editor widget.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbMtlAppRow.BackFlush
member.summary: Indicates if this material will be backflushed. Note: this field is defaulted from Part.BackFlush Backflushing occurs via the write trigger on LaborDtl. The basic idea is to issue material based on the labor quantities reported. The formula for the issue quantity is: (JobMtl.RequiredQty/JobOper.RunQty) * (LaborDtl.LaborQty + LaborDtl.SrapQty).

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbMtlAppRow.EstScrap
member.summary: Estimated Scrap.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbMtlAppRow.EstScrapType
member.summary: Qualifies the EstScrapQty entry as being a fixed quantity or a percentage of required quantity.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbMtlAppRow.FixedQty
member.summary: Indicates if the QtyPer field represents a "Fixed Quantity". If Yes, then the required quantity = QtyPer. That is, the quantity does not change as the number of pieces being produced changes. This can be used to enter Tooling or Fixture type of requirements.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbMtlAppRow.FindNum
member.summary: Characters used on the drawing to show where material is used.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbMtlAppRow.RevisionNum
member.summary: The revision number for the material. An optional field. Defaults from the most current PartRev.RevisionNum.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbMtlAppRow.SndAlrtCmpl
member.summary: Controls if an alert is to be sent when this JobMtl is completed.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbMtlAppRow.RcvInspectionReq
member.summary: Indicates if inspection is required when items are received to this JobMtl. Inspection may also be enforced if the related PartClass, Vendor, PODetail have their "RcvInspectionReq" fields set to Yes.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbMtlAppRow.Plant
member.summary: Site Identifier.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbMtlAppRow.Direct
member.summary: Indicates if this material requirement is going to be satisfied by another job (possibly in another Site), as opposed to a warehouse. If "yes" a WarehouseCode will not be specified.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbMtlAppRow.MaterialMtlCost
member.summary: Total Mtl cost to date. A summary of issue transactions - used track all costs for manufacured parts that were received into inventory then issued as material.. MaterialMtlCost + MaterialLabCost + MaterialSubCost + MaterialBurCost = TotalCost

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbMtlAppRow.MaterialLabCost
member.summary: Total Lab cost to date from parts issued from inventory. A summary of issue transactions - used track all costs for manufacured parts that were received into inventory then issued as material.. IssuedMtlCost + IssuedLabCost + IssuedSubCost + IssuedBurCost = TotalCost

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbMtlAppRow.MaterialSubCost
member.summary: Total Sub cost to date from part issued from inventory. A summary of issue transactions used track all costs for manufacured parts that were received into inventory then issued as material.. IssuedMtlCost + IssuedLabCost + IssuedSubCost + IssuedBurCost = TotalCost

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbMtlAppRow.MaterialBurCost
member.summary: Total Bur cost to date from part issued from inventory. A summary of issue transactions - used track all costs for manufacured parts that were received into inventory then issued as material. IssuedMtlCost + IssuedLabCost + IssuedSubCost + IssuedBurCost = TotalCost

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbMtlAppRow.SalvageMtlCredit
member.summary: Total salvage Mtl credit to date. A summary of salvage receipt transactions. SalvageCredit = SalvageMtlCredit + SalvageLbrCredit + SalvageBurCredit + SalvageSubCredit

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbMtlAppRow.SalvageLbrCredit
member.summary: Total salvage Lbr credit to date. A summary of salvage receipt transactions. SalvageCredit = SalvageMtlCredit + SalvageLbrCredit + SalvageBurCredit + SalvageSubCredit

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbMtlAppRow.SalvageBurCredit
member.summary: Total salvage Burden credit to date. A summary of salvage receipt transactions. SalvageCredit = SalvageMtlCredit + SalvageLbrCredit + SalvageBurCredit + SalvageSubCredit

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbMtlAppRow.SalvageSubCredit
member.summary: Total salvage Subcontract credit to date. A summary of salvage receipt transactions. SalvageCredit = SalvageMtlCredit + SalvageLbrCredit + SalvageBurCredit + SalvageSubCredit

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbMtlAppRow.APSAddResType
member.summary: Advanced Planning and Scheduling Additional Resource Type. Indicates whether the Part should be treated as an AdditionalResourceType by eScheduler. 'I' to ignore in eScheduler 'M' to treat at Material in eScheduler 'A' to treat as AddResType in eScheduler

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbMtlAppRow.CallNum
member.summary: The service call that this Material belongs to.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbMtlAppRow.CallLine
member.summary: The Service Call Line that this material relates to.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbMtlAppRow.ProdCode
member.summary: Product Group Code. Use the Part.ProdCode as a default. This can be blank or must be valid in the ProdGrup table.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbMtlAppRow.UnitPrice
member.summary: FS - Unit Price for the Material in base currency.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbMtlAppRow.BillableUnitPrice
member.summary: FS - Billable Unit Price for the Material in base currency.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbMtlAppRow.DocBillableUnitPrice
member.summary: FS - Billable Price per unit for the material in customers currency.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbMtlAppRow.ResReasonCode
member.summary: Problem reason code from the reason master table. type Service call.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbMtlAppRow.PricePerCode
member.summary: Indicates the pricing per quantity for this part. It can be "E" = per each,"C" = per hundred, "M" = per thousand. Maintainable only via Part Maintenance. The initial default is "E".

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbMtlAppRow.Billable
member.summary: Is this a billable material item.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbMtlAppRow.ShippedQty
member.summary: Holds the quantity of the item that has been shipped through misc. shipments

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbMtlAppRow.DocUnitPrice
member.summary: FS - Unit Price for the Material in Customer currency.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbMtlAppRow.QtyStagedToDate
member.summary: The todate quantity that has been moved to the work centers input Warehouse/Bin. This is NOT A balance. It is a todate value. It is not reduced as it is consumed. Used in calculation of "Outstanding" material in the Request Material program (ame30-dg.w). Only updated if the Advanced Material Mgmt module is installed and only by transactions which "move" the material in/out of the staging area(Issues,Returns).

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbMtlAppRow.AddedMtl
member.summary: This material was added after initial setup of the job

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbMtlAppRow.MiscCharge
member.summary: This indicates that this JobMtl record is for a Misc charge related to this job/assembly.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbMtlAppRow.MiscCode
member.summary: The Miscellaneous Charge Code. This must be valid in the PurMisc master file. It must be a AP Misc. charge.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbMtlAppRow.SCMiscCode
member.summary: The Miscellaneous Charge Code for Service Call billing. This must be valid in the MiscChrg master file. It must be a AR Misc. charge.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbMtlAppRow.RFQNeeded
member.summary: A flag to indicate that this job material requires an RFQ. If it does require an RFQ, the user must enter the number of vendor quotes that are required.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbMtlAppRow.RFQVendQuotes
member.summary: The number of vendor quotes that are required for this job material. Can be zero if RFQ(s) are not required.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbMtlAppRow.RFQNum
member.summary: RFQ number that the item is linked to.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbMtlAppRow.RFQLine
member.summary: The line number of this detail record on the RFQ. This number uniquely identifies the record within the RFQ. The number is not directly maintainable, it's assigned by the system when records are created.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbMtlAppRow.RFQStat
member.summary: RFQ Status. W= Waiting, A = Accepted, R = Requested, C = Received

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbMtlAppRow.AnalysisCode
member.summary: Analysis Code

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbMtlAppRow.GroupSeq
member.summary: GroupSeq

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbMtlAppRow.SysRowID
member.summary: Unique identifier for this row. The value is a GUID.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbMtlAppRow.Append
member.summary: Flag to indicate whether to append this material record

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbMtlAppRow.CurrencyCode
member.summary: Currency Code of the related record

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbMtlAppRow.MtlAltMethod
member.summary: The alternate method for the MtlPart

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbMtlAppRow.AltMethod
member.summary: The alternate method for the material.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbMtlAppRow.MtlRevisionNum
member.summary: The revision number for the MtlPartNum.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbMtlAppRow.LinkGroupSeq
member.summary: Group Sequence used during Job Entry Append Details. This field is used to associate materials to operations.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbMtlAppRow.RowMod
member.summary: RowMod

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbMtlAppRow.SpecifiedProperties
member.summary: SpecifiedProperties

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbOprAppRow.Company
member.summary: Company Identifier.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbOprAppRow.JobComplete
member.summary: Indicates if "Job" is complete. This is a mirror image of JobHead.Complete. Not directly maintainable. When the Job is completed, then all JobOper records are also marked. This is used to make database access to open operation records more efficient.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbOprAppRow.OpComplete
member.summary: Indicates if this operation is completed. This is normally set to complete via labor entry transactions. Not maintainable by Job Entry. It can't be reset to "No" if the JobHead.Complete = Yes. Labor entry setting logic is: If SetUpComplete = Yes and EstProdHours = 0 or ProdComplete = Yes and EstSetHours = 0 or both ProdComplete = Yes and SetupComplete = Yes then OpComplete = Yes. This field is also set by PO receipt entry "issue complete" for subcontract operations.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbOprAppRow.JobNum
member.summary: Job Number

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbOprAppRow.AssemblySeq
member.summary: Assembly Sequence # that this Operation is associated with.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbOprAppRow.OprSeq
member.summary: A sequence number which uniquely identifies the operation record within the Job/lot/level. The sequence can be system generated or assigned by user. System generated numbers are determined by reading last JobOper for the job/lot/level and then figures out what the next number that is divisible by 10. If this number is within 3 of the last Number on file it will be bumped up another 10. This keeps a minimum of 2 available sequences between records. For example if last = 18 Next would be 30, If last = 17 next = 20.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbOprAppRow.OpCode
member.summary: Operation Master Code - Links the JobOper record with a OpMaster record. Default is given from WrkCenter.OpCode. Must be valid in the OpMaster file.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbOprAppRow.OpStdID
member.summary: The Operation standard ID. This links the JobOper to the OpStd master file. This can be blank or if entered must be valid if entered. When this field is changed the ProdStandard, StdFormat and StdBasis should be refreshed with the new defaults. Valid for "inside operations" only.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbOprAppRow.EstSetHours
member.summary: Total estimated set up hours. Calculated as EstSetHoursPerMch * Machines. It is set to zero if operation qty is zero. This is maintained via the JobOper write trigger.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbOprAppRow.EstProdHours
member.summary: The estimated Production run hours for internal operations (JobOper.Subcontract = No) . This is not directly maintainable. It exists so that it will be easier to display than always having to recalculate it when it is needed. It is calculated using the ProdStandard, StdFormat, StdBasis, OpsPerPart, QtyPer, EstScrap and EstScrapType. FORMULAS: If StdFormat = "HR" then EstProdHours = ProdStandard. If StdFormat = "PH" then (JobOper.RunQty / Std). If StdFormat = "PM" then (JobOper.RunQty / Std ) / 60. If StdFormat = "OH" then (JobOper.RunQty/OpsPerPart) / Std. If StdFormat = "OM" then ((JobOper.RunQty/OpsPerPart) / Std) / 60. If StdFormat = "HP" then (JobOPer.RunQty/Basis) X Std. If StdFormat = "MP" then ((JobOper.RunQty/Basis) X Std) / 60.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbOprAppRow.ProdStandard
member.summary: The production standard for the operation. It can be expressed as Hours, Minutes per piece, Pieces per Time, Operations per Minute or Operations per hour. This along with the StdFormat, StdBasis, OpsPer and fields are used to calculate the operations estimated production hours. A value can be defaulted from the OpStd master. NOTE: The ProdStandard can only be zero if the EstSetHours are greater than zero.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbOprAppRow.StdFormat
member.summary: Qualifier for the Production Standard field. This is used as a default to the qualifier field in operation details. The valid qualifiers are; "HP" - Hours/Piece, "MP" - minutes/piece, "PH" - pieces/hour, "PM" - Pieces/Minute, "OH" - Operations/Hour, "OM" - Operations/minute, HR - Fixed Hours.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbOprAppRow.StdBasis
member.summary: A standard basis is to be used to with standards that are time per piece (HP & MP). The basis is a Divisor. Valid codes are E-Eaches, C=100's, M=1000's, T=10,000. This field is used in the formula for calculating the estimated production hours. The operation quantity is divided by the basis value and then multiplied by the standard to result in hours.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbOprAppRow.OpsPerPart
member.summary: Number of operations per part. This is used in the calculation of the estimated production hours when the StdFormat is "OM" or "OH". This should not be accessible if StdFormat is not "OM" or "OH". It MUST BE > 0 if StdFormat is "OM" or "OH".

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbOprAppRow.QtyPer
member.summary: Production Quantity per one of the Parent Item.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbOprAppRow.QueStartDate
member.summary: Scheduled queue start date. Not directly maintainable, updated via the scheduling process.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbOprAppRow.QueStartHour
member.summary: Scheduled queue start hour offset from the beginning of the work day. This field is established by scheduling.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbOprAppRow.StartDate
member.summary: Scheduled production start date. Not directly maintainable, updated via the scheduling process.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbOprAppRow.StartHour
member.summary: This field is established by scheduling. It represents the "Hour offset from the beginning of the work day" when this operation is scheduled to begin.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbOprAppRow.DueDate
member.summary: Scheduled production due date. Not directly maintainable, updated via the scheduling process.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbOprAppRow.DueHour
member.summary: This field is established by scheduling. It represents the "Hour offset from the beginning of the work day" when this operation is scheduled to end.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbOprAppRow.MoveDueDate
member.summary: Scheduled move due date. Not directly maintainable, updated via the scheduling process.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbOprAppRow.MoveDueHour
member.summary: Scheduled move due hour offset from the beginning of the work day. This field is established by scheduling.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbOprAppRow.ProdLabRate
member.summary: Labor rate used for estimated production labor costs. Default from the OpMaster.ProdLabRate.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbOprAppRow.SetupLabRate
member.summary: Labor rate for estimated setup labor costs. Default from the OpMaster.SetupLabRate.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbOprAppRow.ProdBurRate
member.summary: The burden rate to be used for the production time on this operation. (EstProdHrs X ProdBurRate). Default from the WrkCenter.ProdBurRate.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbOprAppRow.SetupBurRate
member.summary: The burden rate to be used for the Setup time on this operation. (EstSetHours X ProdBurRate). Default from the WrkCenter.SetupBurRate.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbOprAppRow.AddedOper
member.summary: This indicates if this is an "added operation". An added operation is one that was not planned on.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbOprAppRow.Machines
member.summary: Defaulted from the WrkCenter.SchMachines field. This is the number of machines that this operation will run on at the same time. Logically thought of as a "Squeeze factor" to scheduling. That is the more machines, the shorter the schedule. This affects how much of the total daily workcenter capacity that the operation will consume. For example; Center has 4 machines, 8 Hours per day and operation 2 machines. This operation would consume 16 hours of capacity per day. So if it had 32 hours of estimated production it would schedule as taking 2 days. NOTE THIS ONLY APPLIES TO PRODUCTION HOURS, TOTAL SETUP HOURS ARE ADDED TO THE SQUEEZED PRODUCTION HOURS TO GET THE NUMBER OF HOURS TO BE SCHEDULED. It is however used to calculate the total setup hours on the operation.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbOprAppRow.SetUpCrewSize
member.summary: Defaulted from the WrkCenter.SetUpCrewSize field. Its the number of people it physically takes to setup this operation. It is used as a multiplier in the estimated labor hours calculation. JobOper.EstSetHours * JobOper.SetUpCrewSize = Estimated Labor hours for the operation. This also affects the estimated labor cost. Est Cost = Est Labor Hours * SetUpLaborRate

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbOprAppRow.ProdCrewSize
member.summary: Defaults from the WrkCenter.ProdCrewSize. The # of people it physically takes to perform the production on this operation per machine that it is run on. CrewSize * JobOper.EstProdHours = Est. Prod. Labor Hours. Note this can be a fraction for operations that do not require full time attention of an employee. See also SetUpCrewSize

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbOprAppRow.ProdComplete
member.summary: A flag indicating if the production is complete for this operation. It is updated via Labor Entry.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbOprAppRow.SetupComplete
member.summary: Flag that indicates if Setup is complete on this operation. This flag is only used when the operation has EstSetupHours > 0.00.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbOprAppRow.ActProdHours
member.summary: Total Actual Production Hours. A summary of non-setup LaborDtl.BurdenHrs. This includes REWORK hours. This is maintained via write/delete triggers on the LaborDtl file. Along with JobOper.ActReworkHours it is used to reduce the shop load if the system is configured to remove load by actual hours (JCSyst.RemoveLoad = "H").

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbOprAppRow.ActProdRwkHours
member.summary: Total Actual Production Rework Hours. A summary of rework labor transactions (LaborDtl.BurdenHrs) where LaborDtl.LaborType = "P" and Rework = Yes. This number is also included as part of the JobOPer.ActProdHours. Maintained via write/delete triggers on the LaborDtl file. Along with JobOper.ActProdHours it is used to reduce the shop load if the system is configured to remove load by actual hours (JCSyst.RemoveLoad = "H"). (See the lib/inopload.i code for load remaining logic)

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbOprAppRow.ActSetupHours
member.summary: Actual setup hours. A summary of setup (LaborDtl.LaborType = S) labor transactions hours (LaborDtl.Burden). Actual Setup hours reduce the shop load if the system is configured to remove load based on hours (JCSyst.RemoveLoad = "H").

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbOprAppRow.ActSetupRwkHours
member.summary: Total Actual Setup Rework Hours. A summary of rework labor transactions (LaborDtl.BurdenHrs) where LaborDtl.LaborType = "S" and Rework = Yes. This number is also included as part of the JobOPer.ActSetupHours. Maintained via write/delete triggers on the LaborDtl file. Along with JobOper.ActSetHours it is used to reduce the shop load if the system is configured to remove load by actual hours (JCSyst.RemoveLoad = "H"). (See the lib/inopload.i code for load remaining logic)

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbOprAppRow.QtyCompleted
member.summary: For Non Subcontract operations: A summary of labor transaction detail. (LaborDtl.LaborQty). Labor entry/collection maintains this field. Only the LaborQty for transactions that are Production labor ( LaborType = P ) and Not rework (LaborDtl.Rework = No) are included in this summary. This quantity is used to reduce shop load when the system is configured to reduce load based on quantity completed. (JCSyst.RemoveLoad = Q) For Subcontract Operations this field is updated by the Purchased Receipt process. The detail records are in the PartTran file.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbOprAppRow.SetupPctComplete
member.summary: Setup function percent complete. Maintained via labor entry.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbOprAppRow.EstScrap
member.summary: EstScrap = a number representing either a scrap qty or a scrap percent depending on the value of EstScrapType field.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbOprAppRow.EstScrapType
member.summary: Qualifies the ScrapQty entry as being a fixed quantity or a percentage of run quantity.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbOprAppRow.SubContract
member.summary: This flags the operation as being a "SubContract" or an "Internal" operation. This also controls what fields are allowed to be updated for this record. For example, an internal operation will not have a PartNum.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbOprAppRow.IUM
member.summary: Inventory UOM

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbOprAppRow.EstUnitCost
member.summary: Estimated Unit Cost for the SubContract operation. Defaults from the Part table if valid PartNum.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbOprAppRow.DaysOut
member.summary: Hours required is calculated as days * 8.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbOprAppRow.PartNum
member.summary: The PartNum to be shipped to the subcontract. Default the JobHead.PartNum or JobAsmbl.PartNum depending on the JobMtl.AssemblySeq.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbOprAppRow.Description
member.summary: Description used only for subcontract operations

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbOprAppRow.VendorNum
member.summary: The SubContractors VendorNum that ties back to the Vendor master file. This is only valid for "SubContract" operations. This field is not directly maintainable, instead its assigned by having the user either enter the "VendorID" and then finding the VendorNum in the Vendor file or by selection list processing. This is a mandatory entry for subcontract operations.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbOprAppRow.PurPoint
member.summary: The Vendors purchase point ID. This field is only for the "Subcontract" operations. Along with the VendorNum is used to tie back to the VendorPP master file. Use the default Purchase point defined in the Vendor file.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbOprAppRow.CommentText
member.summary: Editor widget for Job operation comments.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbOprAppRow.SchedRelation
member.summary: Indicates the scheduling relationship between this and the preceding operation. Possible values are "SS" - Start to Start, "FS" Finish to Start or "FF" Finish to Finish. A "SS" can start when the preceding operation starts. A "FS" starts when the preceding operation is finished. A "FF" can finish when the preceding operation finishes. These relationships do not span between levels of assemblies. The first operation on an assembly is always treated as being "FS" relationship. A "FF" finishes when the preceding operation is finished.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbOprAppRow.RunQty
member.summary: The total operation quantity. This is a calculated field. Calculated as (Assembly Required Qty X QtyPer) + Scrap. The assembly qty is either the JobHead.ProdQty if JobOPer.AssemblySeq = 0 or (JobAsmbl.RequireQty - JobAsmbl.PullQty) if JobOPer.AssemblySeq > 0. This value is refreshed when maintenance is performed on the operation record or an assemblies production qty is changed

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbOprAppRow.WIName
member.summary: This field is blank or contains the UserID. When not blank it indicates that the operations schedule has been changed and is considered as being in a "What If" mode. This field is also used as part of an index which allows the system to quickly find the operations that need to be reset to "Actual Schedule".

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbOprAppRow.WIMachines
member.summary: This is the What-If number of machines that this operation will run on at the same time. Setup by and for scheduling from the Machines field.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbOprAppRow.WIQueStartDate
member.summary: What-if Scheduled queue start date. Not directly maintainable, updated via the scheduling process.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbOprAppRow.WIQueStartHour
member.summary: What-if Scheduled queue start hour offset from the beginning of the work day. This field is established by scheduling.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbOprAppRow.WIStartDate
member.summary: What if Scheduled production start date. Not directly maintainable, updated via the scheduling process.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbOprAppRow.WIStartHour
member.summary: This field is established by scheduling. It represents the What If "Hour offset from the beginning of the work day" when this operation is scheduled to begin.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbOprAppRow.WIDueDate
member.summary: What If Scheduled production due date. Not directly maintainable, updated via the scheduling process.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbOprAppRow.WIDueHour
member.summary: This field is established by scheduling. It represents the "Hour offset from the beginning of the work day" when this operation is scheduled to end.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbOprAppRow.WIMoveDueDate
member.summary: What-If Scheduled move due date. Not directly maintainable, updated via the scheduling process.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbOprAppRow.WIMoveDueHour
member.summary: What-if Scheduled move due hour offset from the beginning of the work day. This field is established by scheduling.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbOprAppRow.WIHoursPerMachine
member.summary: The Number of Hours per machine per day that this operations "What If" schedule is based on. This is for "Inbetween" days, not first or last days. It is a copy of WrkCenter.HoursPerMachine field at the time of scheduling. Used in logic of maintaining ShopLoad records.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbOprAppRow.WILoadDate
member.summary: Date at which the operations current outstanding "What-If" load starts at. Updated by the JobOper write trigger. (See LoadDate)

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbOprAppRow.WILoadHour
member.summary: "Hour offset from the beginning of the work day" for the operations outstanding "What-If" load. Related to WILoadDate.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbOprAppRow.ActBurCost
member.summary: Total Burden cost to date. This is update via the LaborDtl\Write.p trigger procedure. It includes ALL burden costs (Setup, Production and Rework)

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbOprAppRow.ActLabCost
member.summary: FOR NON-SUBCONTRACT OPERATIONS: Total of "ALL" labor costs to date. This includes Setup, Production and Rework. Updated via the LaborDtl.Write.p trigger. FOR SUBCONTRACT OPERATIONS: The Total Cost, updated via the receipt process.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbOprAppRow.ReworkBurCost
member.summary: Total Rework Burden cost todate. This value is also included in the ActBurCost total. It includes both setup & production rework. Updated via LaborDtl\Write.P trigger.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbOprAppRow.ReworkLabCost
member.summary: Total Rework Labor cost to date. This value is also included in the ActLabCost field. This includes both Setup & Production. Updated via the LaborDtl\Write.p trigger.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbOprAppRow.MiscAmt
member.summary: A total additional charge that is incurred when purchasing this service. Ex(Lot,Setup,Handling,etc...). Defaulted from VendPart.MiscAmt. This is NOT part of the a Unit Cost. It is NOT consider in the logic of using Minimum Cost.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbOprAppRow.HoursPerMachine
member.summary: The Number of Hours per machine per day that this operations "actual" schedule is based on. This is for "Inbetween" days, not first or last days. It is a copy of WrkCenter.HoursPerMachine field at the time of scheduling. Used in logic of maintaining the ShopLoad records.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbOprAppRow.LoadDate
member.summary: Date at which the operations current outstanding load starts at. Ex: Op schedule is 2/1/97 - 2/10/97, initially LoadDate = 2/1/97. As load is relieved through labor processing the LoadDate moves forward accordingly. When 1/2 completed the LoadDate would be 2/5/97. This field is primarily used by the Scheduling Board to calculate the graphical image of outstanding load. Updated by the JobOper write trigger.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbOprAppRow.LoadHour
member.summary: "Hour offset from the beginning of the work day" for the operations outstanding load. Related to LoadDate.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbOprAppRow.ReloadNum
member.summary: Internally used field to prevent redundant read of JobOper during execution of "Reloader" program. (See WrkCenter.ReloadNum)

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbOprAppRow.SndAlrtCmpl
member.summary: Controls if an alert is to be sent when this JobOper is completed.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbOprAppRow.RcvInspectionReq
member.summary: Indicates if Inspection is required when items are received to this JobOper (subcontract only). Inspection may also be enforced if the related PartClass, Vendor, PODetail have their "RcvInspectionReq" fields set to Yes.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbOprAppRow.JobEngineered
member.summary: Identical to JobHead.JobEngineered. ShopLoad capacity is only allocated to Jobs where JobEngineered = YES.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbOprAppRow.EstSetHoursPerMch
member.summary: The estimated set up hours per machine. Default from OpStd.SetupHours. Used to calculate JobOper.EstSetupHours.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbOprAppRow.RevisionNum
member.summary: Part Revision number. Pertains to subcontracting operations only. An optional field. Related JobAsmbl.RevisionNum is used as the default.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbOprAppRow.AutoReceiptDate
member.summary: Currently not used. Prep for future development.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbOprAppRow.LastLaborDate
member.summary: The labor date of the last labor transaction that was posted to this operation. Used by the JobOper write trigger Auto Receieve logic.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbOprAppRow.CallNum
member.summary: The service call that this operation belongs to.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbOprAppRow.CallLine
member.summary: The Service Call Line that this operation relates to.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbOprAppRow.LaborRate
member.summary: Labor rate used for time on an operation. Time per hour per technician. in base currency.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbOprAppRow.BillableLaborRate
member.summary: Billable Labor rate used for time on a service. Time per hour per technician. in base currency. This field considers the percentage coverage of a warranty or contract.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbOprAppRow.DocLaborRate
member.summary: Labor rate used for time on a service. Time per hour per technician. In Customer currency. Does not consider warranty or contract

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbOprAppRow.DocBillableLaborRate
member.summary: Billable Labor rate used for time on a service. Time per hour per technician. In Customer currency. considers warranty or contract

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbOprAppRow.Billable
member.summary: FS - Is this a billable operation.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbOprAppRow.UnitPrice
member.summary: FS - Unit Price for the subcontract in base currency.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbOprAppRow.BillableUnitPrice
member.summary: FS - Billable Unit Price for the subcontract in base currency.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbOprAppRow.DocBillableUnitPrice
member.summary: FS - Billable Price per unit for the subcontract in customers currency.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbOprAppRow.DocUnitPrice
member.summary: FS - Unit Price for the for the Subcontract in Customer currency.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbOprAppRow.LaborEntryMethod
member.summary: Indicates the Method for Labor Entry. Can be "T" - Time and Quantity, "Q" - Quantity Only (Time is estimated), "B" - Backflush or "X" - Time - Backflush Qty.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbOprAppRow.PricePerCode
member.summary: Indicates the pricing per quantity for this part. It can be "E" = per each,"C" = per hundred, "M" = per thousand. Maintainable only via Part Maintenance. The initial default is "E".

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbOprAppRow.FAQty
member.summary: The quantity requested for first article inspection.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbOprAppRow.QtyStagedToDate
member.summary: The "to date" quantity that has been moved to the input Warehouse/Bin of the subsequent operations ResourceGroup/Resource input Warehouse/Bin. This is NOT A balance. It is a "to date" value. It is not reduced as it is consumed. Used in calculation of "Outstanding" WIP in the Request Material/WIP program (ame30-dg.w). Only updated if the Advanced Material Mgmt module is installed and only by transactions which "move" the WIP material in/out of the staging area (Issues, Returns).

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbOprAppRow.RFQNeeded
member.summary: A flag to indicate that this job operation requires an RFQ. If it does require an RFQ, the user must enter the number of vendor quotes that are required. This only applies to subcontract operations.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbOprAppRow.RFQVendQuotes
member.summary: The number of vendor quotes that are required for this job subcontract operation. Can be zero if RFQ(s) are not required.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbOprAppRow.RFQNum
member.summary: RFQ number that the item is linked to.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbOprAppRow.RFQLine
member.summary: The line number of this detail record on the RFQ. This number uniquely identifies the record within the RFQ. The number is not directly maintainable, it's assigned by the system when records are created.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbOprAppRow.RFQStat
member.summary: RFQ Status. W= Waiting, A = Accepted, R = Requested, C = Received

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbOprAppRow.SetupGroup
member.summary: Used to group operation to save on setups.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbOprAppRow.RestoreFlag
member.summary: Used to determine if this record was modified during the last What-If Schedule Restore. The contents are Date-Time. Example: "04/11/02-34221".

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbOprAppRow.AnalysisCode
member.summary: Analysis Code

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbOprAppRow.PrimarySetupOpDtl
member.summary: Identifies the primary JobOpDtl to be used for setup. The setup time for the operation is determined on the JobOpDtl. If <> 0, must identify a valid JobOpDtl. The JobOpDtl needs to have a RequiredFor = S or B.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbOprAppRow.PrimaryProdOpDtl
member.summary: Identifies the primary JobOpDtl to be used for production. The production run time for the operation is determined on the JobOpDtl. If <> 0, must identify a valid JobOpDtl. The JobOpDtl needs to have a RequiredFor = P or B.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbOprAppRow.SysRowID
member.summary: Unique identifier for this row. The value is a GUID.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbOprAppRow.QtyPerCycle
member.summary: Number of pieces created per cycle if Cycle/Minute or Cycle/Hour is selected

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbOprAppRow.Append
member.summary: Indicates whether to append this operation

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbOprAppRow.AppendedOprSeq
member.summary: The new operation sequence (for related operations)

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbOprAppRow.FinalOperation
member.summary: Indicates if final operation

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbOprAppRow.CurrencyCode
member.summary: Currency Code of the related record

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbOprAppRow.AltMethod
member.summary: Job Oper Alternate Method.

member.summary: Target Assembly Sequence used during Job Entry Append Details.

member.summary: Target Assembly Sequence used during Job Entry Append Details.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JbOprAppRow.GroupSeq
member.summary: Group Sequence used during Job Entry Append Details. This field is used to associate materials to operations.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobHeadRow.Company
member.summary: Company Identifier.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobHeadRow.JobClosed
member.summary: Indicates if Job is closed. A closed Job cannot be accessed for maintenance.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobHeadRow.ClosedDate
member.summary: Date the Job was closed. Defaults as the system but can be overridden.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobHeadRow.JobComplete
member.summary: Indicates if production is complete for the job. A complete job cannot be scheduled. It can still have cost posted against it. Maintained via Job Completion processing.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobHeadRow.JobCompletionDate
member.summary: The date that production was completed for this Job. Maintained via Job Completion Processing.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobHeadRow.JobEngineered
member.summary: Indicates if Engineering is complete for this job. That is, all departments that need to "check off" on this job before it is actually considered ready to go have done so. A job must be Engineered before it can be scheduled. Non Engineered Jobs are excluded from most reports.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobHeadRow.CheckOff1
member.summary: Optional Job check off number 1. The label for this field is found in JCSyst. If the label field is blank then field should be invisible. These "check offs" will be used for selecting jobs. An example would be a "Engineering" or "Purchasing" check off.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobHeadRow.CheckOff2
member.summary: Optional Job check off number 2. The label for this field is found in JCSyst. If the label field is blank then field should be invisible. These "check offs" will be used for selecting jobs. An example would be a "Engineering" or "Purchasing" check off.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobHeadRow.CheckOff3
member.summary: Optional Job check off number 3. The label for this field is found in JCSyst. If the label field is blank then field should be invisible. These "check offs" will be used for selecting jobs. An example would be a "Engineering" or "Purchasing" check off.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobHeadRow.CheckOff4
member.summary: Optional Job check off number 4. The label for this field is found in JCSyst. If the label field is blank then field should be invisible. These "check offs" will be used for selecting jobs. An example would be a "Engineering" or "Purchasing" check off.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobHeadRow.CheckOff5
member.summary: Optional Job check off number 5. The label for this field is found in JCSyst. If the label field is blank then field should be invisible. These "check offs" will be used for selecting jobs. An example would be a "Engineering" or "Purchasing" check off.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobHeadRow.JobReleased
member.summary: Indicates if job has been "Released" to production. Only jobs that are released can have labor posted against them. Once labor is posted to a Job this flag cannot be changed.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobHeadRow.JobHeld
member.summary: Indicates if the Job has been placed on "HOLD". Currently this field is only used for display purposes. It may be used later to prevent or provide warnings and messages in appropriate areas such as Shipping, Purchasing, Labor processing, etc.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobHeadRow.SchedStatus
member.summary: Scheduling Status Control (R-Required, P-Pending, A-Active, C-Complete). NOT CURRENTLY IMPLEMENTED.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobHeadRow.JobNum
member.summary: Job number. Unique key to identify the production job. When adding "new" records and this is left blank the system will assign a job number. Assigning numbers will be done by using a "database" sequence number. Then using that number loop and increment until an available number is found.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobHeadRow.PartNum
member.summary: Part number of the manufactured item. Does not have to be valid in the Part master. Cannot be blank. With verion 8.0 and Advanced Production License a job can have multiple end parts. These are defined in the JobPart table. This field has not changed. But will now be used to indicate the primary end part that is being produced. That is, the JobPart record where JobPart.PartNum = JobHead.PartNum will be considered as the primary end part. A primary part is only significant on Concurrent mode of production, because it?s quantity drives the material/operation requirements.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobHeadRow.RevisionNum
member.summary: Part Revision number. Defaults from the most current PartRev.RevisionNum.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobHeadRow.DrawNum
member.summary: Engineering Drawing Number. An optional field. Defaulted from BomHead.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobHeadRow.PartDescription
member.summary: The description of the part that is to be manufactured. Use the Part.Description as the default.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobHeadRow.ProdQty
member.summary: This field is not directly maintainable. The value stored here will be different than it was in the pre 8.0- versions. If ProcessMode is Sequential then this is a total of ALL end parts that are being produced on the job. If Concurrent then it is the production quantity of the primary part /PartsPerOp . For example 1000 bottle caps are require, 100 caps are produced per machine cycle would result in ProdQty of 10. See JobPart table for information on end parts of a job.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobHeadRow.IUM
member.summary: The unit of measure for the job. Defaulted from Part.IUM.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobHeadRow.StartDate
member.summary: The Scheduled job start date (including queue time). This is not directly user maintainable. It is calculated/updated via the scheduling functions

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobHeadRow.StartHour
member.summary: This field is established by scheduling. It represents the "Hour offset from the beginning of the work day" when this job is scheduled to begin (including queue time).

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobHeadRow.DueDate
member.summary: Scheduled finish date for the entire Job (including move time). This is not user maintainable. It is updated via the scheduling process.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobHeadRow.DueHour
member.summary: This field is established by scheduling. It represents the "Hour offset from the beginning of the work day" when this job is scheduled to end (including move time).

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobHeadRow.ReqDueDate
member.summary: Indicates the date at which this job needs to be completed. This is maintainable by the user. It can be defaulted as the earliest due date of the linked orders. This due date is used as the default date for "backward" scheduling of the job.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobHeadRow.JobCode
member.summary: An optional user defined code. This will be used for report selections and views of job headers.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobHeadRow.QuoteNum
member.summary: Contains the Quote number reference. This was assigned when the job details were pulled in from the quote. It will be used to show quote figures compared to estimated and actual.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobHeadRow.QuoteLine
member.summary: Contains the quote line number reference. (see QuoteNum )

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobHeadRow.ProdCode
member.summary: Product Group Code. Use the Part.ProdCode as a default. This can be blank or must be valid in the ProdGrup table.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobHeadRow.UserChar1
member.summary: UserChar1

member.summary: UserChar2

member.summary: UserDate1

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobHeadRow.UserDate2
member.summary: UserDate2

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobHeadRow.UserDate3
member.summary: UserDate3

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobHeadRow.UserDate4
member.summary: UserDate4

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobHeadRow.UserDecimal1
member.summary: UserDecimal1

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobHeadRow.UserDecimal2
member.summary: UserDecimal2

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobHeadRow.UserInteger1
member.summary: UserInteger1

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobHeadRow.UserInteger2
member.summary: UserInteger2

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobHeadRow.CommentText
member.summary: Editor widget for Job header comments.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobHeadRow.ExpenseCode
member.summary: The default override expense code that will be used for all labor reported against this job. When this is entered then it will override all over default logic for developing the default G/L expense account in labor entry. This can be blank or must be valid in the LabExpCd master file.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobHeadRow.InCopyList
member.summary: Indicates if the final assembly is to be included in the browse of assemblies in the "get details" function. The user can use to option to keep the "Copy from" list from becoming cluttered with too many assemblies. This does not prevent the user from copying this assembly it just keeps it out of the browse.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobHeadRow.WIName
member.summary: This field is blank or contains the UserID. When not blank it indicates that some or all the operations of this job are in a "What if" scheduling mode. In this condition the scheduling board prevents other users from modifying any operations on this job until the changes get committed. This field is also used as part of an index which allows the system to quickly find the operations that need to be reset to "Actual Schedule".

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobHeadRow.WIStartDate
member.summary: The Scheduled "What If" job start date (including queue time). This is not directly user maintainable. It is calculated/updated via the scheduling functions

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobHeadRow.WIStartHour
member.summary: This field is established by scheduling. It represents the What-If "Hour offset from the beginning of the work day" when this job is scheduled to begin (including queue time).

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobHeadRow.WIDueDate
member.summary: Scheduled "What If" finish date for the entire Job (including move time). This is not user maintainable. It is updated via the scheduling process.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobHeadRow.WIDueHour
member.summary: This field is established by scheduling. It represents the What-If "Hour offset from the beginning of the work day" when this job is scheduled to end (including move time).

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobHeadRow.Candidate
member.summary: Indicates if the system considers this Job as a candidate for the completion process. Jobs that are marked as JobClosed = No, JobComplete = No and Candidate = Yes can be viewed in the Job Completion/Closing program by selecting the Candidates option. This field is not directly maintainable. It is set to based on the value of JobOper.OpComplete of the last operation of the final assembly.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobHeadRow.SchedCode
member.summary: Scheduling Code. SchedCode references a record in the SchedPri table.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobHeadRow.SchedLocked
member.summary: If yes the Jobs' schedule is locked, and not affected by the SchedCode. Locked jobs are allocated (and over-allocated) machine time before any non-locked jobs are scheduled.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobHeadRow.ProjectID
member.summary: Associates the JobHead with a project in the Project table. This can be blank.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobHeadRow.WIPCleared
member.summary: For closed jobs (JobHead.JobClosed = yes) this indicates if all of the costs on this job have been removed from WIP. Costs are moved out of WIP during the "Generate WIP transactions" process.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobHeadRow.JobFirm
member.summary: A flag which controls whether or not the MRP process can make changes to this job. MRP can only make changes when JobFirm = No.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobHeadRow.PersonList
member.summary: A LIST-DELIM delimited list of people.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobHeadRow.PersonID
member.summary: Identifies the Person to be used as the Production Planner. This person is responsible for handling the manufacturing suggestions to this job. Manufacturing suggestions can be filtered by Planner. Relates to the Person table. Defaults from the ProdGrup.PersonID.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobHeadRow.ProdTeamID
member.summary: Production Team for the Job. Associates the JobHead with a ProdTeam.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobHeadRow.QtyCompleted
member.summary: Production quantity completed. Updated via JobOper write trigger. If JobOper is the "Final Operation" (see JobAsmbl.FinalOpr) then this is set equal to JobOper.QtyCompleted.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobHeadRow.Plant
member.summary: Site Identifier.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobHeadRow.DatePurged
member.summary: The date the detail for the Job was purged. The detail is the LaborDtl, PartTrans, and JobOpMac records associated with the job. Once details have been purged the job cannot be reopened. A job must be closed for it to be purged.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobHeadRow.TravelerReadyToPrint
member.summary: Indicates if the Traveler can be printed. Print functions are not available if this is = No.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobHeadRow.TravelerLastPrinted
member.summary: The last date the job traveler was mass printed.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobHeadRow.StatusReadyToPrint
member.summary: Indicates if the Status can be printed. Print functions are not available if this is = No.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobHeadRow.StatusLastPrinted
member.summary: The last date the job status was mass printed.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobHeadRow.CallNum
member.summary: The Service Call number that this Job is linked to.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobHeadRow.CallLine
member.summary: The Service Call Line that this Job is linked to.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobHeadRow.JobType
member.summary: Describe the type of job this is: MFG = Manufacturing, MNT = Maintenance, PRJ = Project, SRV = Service

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobHeadRow.RestoreFlag
member.summary: Used to determine if this record was modified during the last What-If Schedule Restore. The contents are Date-Time. Example: "04/11/02-34221".

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobHeadRow.PhaseID
member.summary: Project Phase ID

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobHeadRow.AnalysisCode
member.summary: Analysis Code

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobHeadRow.LockQty
member.summary: Indicates that the quantity on this job is locked

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobHeadRow.HDCaseNum
member.summary: The help desk case that created this job.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobHeadRow.ProcessMode
member.summary: Values: S(Sequential) or C(Concurrent). Defaults as S. Must have Advanced Production License to change. Controls how the operations and material requirements are developed. Concurrent jobs are used where the production time is based on the number of machine operations performed and not on the number of parts created. For example, a stamping operation where each cycle of the machine stamps out x number of parts. A further extension of this is that the operation can yield multiple different parts from each cycle of the machine. Identification of these parts and there associated PPO (parts per operation) is define in the JobPart table.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobHeadRow.PlannedActionDate
member.summary: The planned date when the job needs to be actioned by the production department to make sure that the job is ready on the planned completion date.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobHeadRow.PlannedKitDate
member.summary: The date that the job needs to be ready for the warehouse to kit to make sure that it is ready for the job start date.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobHeadRow.MSPTaskID
member.summary: The task ID that is returned from Microsoft Projects.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobHeadRow.MSPPredecessor
member.summary: This is the Microsoft Project predecessor. This needs to be a text field as MSP may pass back an alpha numeric string.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobHeadRow.UserMapData
member.summary: Character field that will contain the coma separated data that has been returned from Microsoft Projects. This data will be retained exactly as it was returned from MSP. This field will NOT be editable within Vantage.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobHeadRow.ProductionYield
member.summary: Flag to indicate whether operations for this job will use the production yield features set up in OpMaster for the operation code. Defaulted from Site.ProductionYield

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobHeadRow.OrigProdQty
member.summary: This field will be set to the value of the JobHead.ProdQty at the time the JobHead.Engineered flag is set to true.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobHeadRow.PreserveOrigQtys
member.summary: This field is used to indicate whether the original quantities should be reset in the job header and its assemblies at JobHead update if JobHead.JobEngineered has been changed from false to true. Generally the orig qtys will be reset, unless this flag is set to true because the user was asked if they wanted to reset the orig qtys and they answered yes.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobHeadRow.NoAutoCompletion
member.summary: If set to yes then exclude this job from the Job Auto-Completion process. Not directly maintainable.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobHeadRow.NoAutoClosing
member.summary: No Auto Closing. If set to yes then exclude this job from the Job Auto-Closing process.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobHeadRow.CreatedBy
member.summary: The user that created this Job.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobHeadRow.CreateDate
member.summary: The date that this Job was created.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobHeadRow.WhseAllocFlag
member.summary: Indicates if the PartWhse allocation needs to be/has been updated by the new time delated process.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobHeadRow.OwnershipStatus
member.summary: This field can be used with external system integrations to identify which system currently has ownership of the record. This field can hold either the name of the external system (example: PDM), ERP (Vantage) or null.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobHeadRow.PDMObjID
member.summary: Holds the internal object id of PDM parts.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobHeadRow.ExportRequested
member.summary: This field is used to store a code that represents the external system that the Job is being exported to (ex. PDM). This field is short lived, it is used to instruct the write trigger logic to create IM records for certain types of external systems. After creating the IM records, the trigger logic should immediately clear the field.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobHeadRow.SplitMfgCostElements
member.summary: Flag to indicate how to split the manufacturing cost elements when a manufactured material is issued to the job. If flag is set to true, the cost of the issued material will be split into individual manufacturing cost elements. If set to false, the cost of the issued material is added to the manufacturing material cost element only. This is defaulted from the JCSyst.SplitMfgCostElements and is not user maintainable.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobHeadRow.XRefPartNum
member.summary: Cross Reference Part Num. Used for alternate serial mask support.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobHeadRow.XRefPartType
member.summary:
Cross Reference Part Type. Used for alternate serial mask support.
I=Internal Cross Reference / C = Customer Part

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobHeadRow.XRefCustNum
member.summary: Customer Number XRefPartNum is related to if it is a customer part. Used for alternate serial number mask support.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobHeadRow.BasePartNum
member.summary: Base Part Number. Used in the configurator to identify the configurator part Number.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobHeadRow.BaseRevisionNum
member.summary: Base Revision Number. Used in the configurator to identify the configurator part revision Number.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobHeadRow.RoughCutScheduled
member.summary: Indicates if the job was rough cut scheduled.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobHeadRow.EquipID
member.summary: The ID of the Equipment that this "Maintenance Job" is for. Foreign key component to Equip table.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobHeadRow.PlanNum
member.summary: Preventive Maintenance Plan Number that this "Maintenance Job" is for. Foreign key component to EquipPlan table. Note: A Maintenance Job does not have to be for a Preventive Maintenance plan, in which case this is zero. If time based plan, then the closing process will update the EquipPlan.NextDate. Therefore, the Job must know the EquipID and PlanNum in order to do this.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobHeadRow.MaintPriority
member.summary: Maintenance Job Priority. Valid values: H - High, M - Medium, L - Low. M is default or if created from a Maint Request then MaintReq.Priority is used as default.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobHeadRow.SplitJob
