member.summary: Company Identifier.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobAsmblRow.JobComplete
member.summary: Indicates if the Job is complete. This is a mirror image of JobHead.JobComplete. Not directly maintainable. When Job is complete, then all assembly records are also marked complete. This is used to make database access to open assembly records more efficient.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobAsmblRow.JobNum
member.summary: Job Number. Associates the assembly record back its parent JobHead record. Not directly maintainable.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobAsmblRow.AssemblySeq
member.summary: A sequence number that uniquely identifies the JobAsmbl record within the JobNum. This can be user assigned or assigned by the system. The system assigns the next available number during add mode if its left blank.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobAsmblRow.PartNum
member.summary: Part number for this assembly. Cannot be blank. Does not have to be valid in the Part master file.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobAsmblRow.Description
member.summary: Description for the Part on the assembly record. This cannot be blank. Use Part.Description as default if a valid Part record exists.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobAsmblRow.RevisionNum
member.summary: The revision number for the assembly. An optional field. Defaults from the most current PartRev.RevisionNum.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobAsmblRow.QtyPer
member.summary: The production quantity required for this assembly per one of it's parent part.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobAsmblRow.IUM
member.summary: The internal unit of measure for this assembly. Use the Part.IUM as a default.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobAsmblRow.RequiredQty
member.summary: This is how many of the assemblies are required to produce the END ITEM. This is a calculated field. Calculated as the (( Parents RequiredQty - Parents PullQty) X QtyPer) + OverRunQty. This field needs to be refreshed whenever a change is made to the production quantity in any of its parents or when its QtyPer, or Overrun fields are changed. The refresh may also occur if the structure of the assemblies is changed. The production quantity for the assembly which will drive raw material requirements and estimated production times can be determined by ( RequiredQty - PullQty).

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobAsmblRow.PullQty
member.summary: This indicates a quantity that will be pulled from inventory for this assembly instead of being manufactured. This is a fixed quantity and is not affected by QtyPer type changes. If this a valid Part, then it must update the PartWhse.AllocQty.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobAsmblRow.WarehouseCode
member.summary: This is the warehouse that the material is allocated against.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobAsmblRow.MtlBurRate
member.summary: The material burden rate for this Job Assembly.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobAsmblRow.EstUnitCost
member.summary: The estimated unit cost for the assembly quantity (JobAsmbl.PullQty) that will be pulled from inventory. Use the appropriate cost found in the Part file as a default. That is, select the cost fields based on Part.CostMethod. Then crossfoot the labor, burden and material into the EstUnitCost field.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobAsmblRow.EstMtlBurUnitCost
member.summary: The estimated Mtl burden unit cost for the assembly quantity (JobAsmbl.PullQty) that will be pulled from inventory. Use the appropriate cost found in the Part file as a default. That is, select the cost fields based on Part.CostMethod.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobAsmblRow.OverRunQty
member.summary: This value indicates a quantity that is planned to be overrun and put into inventory. This is kept as a separate field so that is does not distort the BOM requirement relationships. This increases the total production quantity for the assembly. This is a FIXED quantity and is not affected by structure or qty/per type changes.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobAsmblRow.StartDate
member.summary: Scheduled start date for the assembly (including queue time). This is not user maintainable. It is updated by the scheduling process.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobAsmblRow.StartHour
member.summary: This field is established by scheduling. It represents the "Hour offset from the beginning of the work day" when this assembly is scheduled to begin (including queue time). Scheduling uses the StartDate and StartHour of the parent assembly as the beginning Date/Hour when Backward scheduling subassemblies.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobAsmblRow.DueDate
member.summary: The scheduled due date for the assembly (including move time). Not user maintainable, updated via the scheduling process.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobAsmblRow.DueHour
member.summary: This field is established by scheduling. It represents the "Hour offset from the beginning of the work day" when this assembly is scheduled to end (including move time).

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobAsmblRow.Parent
member.summary: Sequence number of the Parent Assembly.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobAsmblRow.PriorPeer
member.summary: The sequence number of the prior assembly that is on the same level as this assembly. This is known as a PriorPeer assembly. This is automatically maintained by the maintenance programs. The logic is to find an assembly where the Parent is the same and the NextPeer is -1. Then NextPeer of that assembly gets updated with this assemblies sequence number and this assembly gets its PriorPeer field updated with the sequence number from the assembly which was found.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobAsmblRow.NextPeer
member.summary: The sequence number of the Next Assembly on the same level as this assembly. This is known as a NextPeer assembly. Automatically maintained by the maintenance programs. The logic is to find an assembly where the Parent is the same and the PriorPeer is -1. Then the PriorPeer of that assembly is updated with this assemblies sequence number and then this assemblies NextPeer gets updated with the sequence number from the assembly that was found.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobAsmblRow.Child
member.summary: Sequence number of this assemblies very first subassembly. This is known as the Child assembly. Automatically maintained by the maintenance programs. The logic is to find the Parent assembly record and if its child is -1, update it with this assemblies sequence number.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobAsmblRow.TotalCost
member.summary: Total cost to date, of this component that was issued from stock.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobAsmblRow.MtlBurCost
member.summary: Total material burden cost to date, of this component that was issued from stock.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobAsmblRow.IssuedQty
member.summary: This quantity is a summary of all Issue Transactions that were issued to meet this assemblies PullQty requirements. This is not directly maintainable.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobAsmblRow.DrawNum
member.summary: Optional field for Engineering Drawing Number. Defaulted from BomHead.DrawNum during methods pull functions.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobAsmblRow.IssuedComplete
member.summary: Indicates if the pull quantity has been issued complete. If "yes" then this record is NOT part of the PartWhse.AllocQty total even if it had been issued less than the original required quantity. The user may toggle the setting if the JobHead.Complete is "NO". When it is toggled the allocation logic will be triggered if necessary.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobAsmblRow.CommentText
member.summary: Editor widget for Job Assembly comments.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobAsmblRow.InCopyList
member.summary: Indicates if this assembly is to be included in the browse of assemblies in the "get details" function. The user can use this option to keep the "Copy from" list from becoming cluttered with too many assemblies. This does not prevent the user from copying this assembly, it just keeps it out of the browse.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobAsmblRow.BomSequence
member.summary: An internally system assigned integer which is used as part of an index to organize the records into a Bill of Material fashion sequence.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobAsmblRow.BomLevel
member.summary: An internally system assigned integer which represents the "Level of Indention" of the assembly in reference to the Bill of Material structure.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobAsmblRow.WIStartDate
member.summary: Scheduled "What If" start date for the assembly (including queue time). This is not user maintainable. It is updated by the scheduling process

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobAsmblRow.WIStartHour
member.summary: This field is established by scheduling. It represents the What-If "Hour offset from the beginning of the work day" when this assembly is scheduled to begin (including queue time). Scheduling uses the StartDate and StartHour of the parent assembly as the beginning Date/Hour when Backward scheduling subassemblies.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobAsmblRow.WIDueDate
member.summary: The scheduled "What-If" due date for the assembly (including move time). Not user maintainable, updated via the scheduling process.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobAsmblRow.WIDueHour
member.summary: This field is established by scheduling. It represents the What-If "Hour offset from the beginning of the work day" when this assembly is scheduled to end (including move time).

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobAsmblRow.AutoRecOpr
member.summary: The operation number (JobOper.OprSeq) that is marked to do the Automatic Receipt to inventory. Note: Zero = no operation is set to perform the auto receive into inventory function. This field is not directly maintainable. Instead it is set during operation maintenance by having the user mark a check box indicating "Auto Receive" which then updates this field with the operations sequence number.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobAsmblRow.FinalOpr
member.summary: The sequence of the operation that is to be considered as the operation which indicates the quantity complete for the Job/Assembly. In other words this operations completed quantity = Job/Assembly completed. Note: Zero = no operation is set and that the system should use the last operation to determine quantity complete. This field is not directly maintainable. Instead it is set during operation maintenance by having the user mark a check box indicating "Final Operation" which then updates this field with the operations sequence number.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobAsmblRow.FindNum
member.summary: FUTURE IMPLEMENTATION - Characters used on the parent assembly drawing to show where assembly is used.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobAsmblRow.ReceivedToStock
member.summary: Total received to stock. This pertains receiving an OverRun quantity. Used to update the PartDtl file for expected production quantity. PartDtl is OverRun - ReceivedToStock.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobAsmblRow.Plant
member.summary: Site Identifier.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobAsmblRow.Direct
member.summary: Indicates if this assembly material requirement is going to be satisfied by another job (possibly in another Site), as opposed to a warehouse. If "yes" a WarehouseCode will not be specified..

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobAsmblRow.RelatedOperation
member.summary: An assembly record can be related to a specific operation. This field contains the JobOper.OprSeq of the operation that it is related to. It can be left as zero meaning that this assembly is required at the very beginning of the production job. The related operation is also used to calculate scheduled start date.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobAsmblRow.TLAMaterialLabCost
member.summary: This Level Actual Material Labor Cost. Depending on the setting of JCSyst.SplitMfgCostElements, if set to true then TLAMaterialLabCost is the Total Labor costs of all manufactured parts issued as material for this level (independent of TLAMaterialCost). Otherwise, TLAMaterialLabCost is one of the component costs that makes up the TLAMaterialCost (i.e. TLAMaterialCost = TLAMaterialLabCost + TLAMaterialMtlCost + TLAMaterialSubCost + TLAMaterialBurCost).

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobAsmblRow.TLAMaterialMtlCost
member.summary: This Level Actual Issued Material Cost. Depending on the setting of JCSyst.SplitMfgCostElements, if set to true then TLAMaterialMtlCost is the Total Material costs of all manufactured parts issued as material for this level (independent of TLAMaterialCost). Otherwise, TLAMaterialMtlCost is one of the component costs that makes up the TLAMaterialCost (i.e. TLAMaterialCost = TLAMaterialLabCost + TLAMaterialMtlCost + TLAMaterialSubCost + TLAMaterialBurCost).

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobAsmblRow.TLAMaterialSubCost
member.summary: This Level Actual Material Subcontract Cost. Depending on the setting of JCSyst.SplitMfgCostElements, if set to true then TLAMaterialSubCost is the Total Subcontract costs of all manufactured parts issued as material for this level (independent of TLAMaterialCost). Otherwise, TLAMaterialSubCost is one of the component costs that makes up the TLAMaterialCost (i.e. TLAMaterialCost = TLAMaterialLabCost + TLAMaterialMtlCost + TLAMaterialSubCost + TLAMaterialBurCost).

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobAsmblRow.TLAMaterialBurCost
member.summary: This Level Actual Material Burden Cost. Depending on the setting of JCSyst.SplitMfgCostElements, if set to true then TLAMaterialBurCost is the Total Burden costs of all manufactured parts issued as material for this level (independent of TLAMaterialCost). Otherwise, TLAMaterialBurCost is one of the component costs that makes up the TLAMaterialCost (i.e. TLAMaterialCost = TLAMaterialLabCost + TLAMaterialMtlCost + TLAMaterialSubCost + TLAMaterialBurCost).

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobAsmblRow.LLAMaterialLabCost
member.summary: Lower Level Actual Material Labor Cost. Depending on the setting of JCSyst.SplitMfgCostElements, if set to true then LLAMaterialLabCost is the Total Labor costs of all manufactured parts issued as material for the lower level (independent of LLAMaterialCost). Otherwise, LLAMaterialLabCost is one of the component costs that makes up the LLAMaterialCost (i.e. LLAMaterialCost = LLAMaterialLabCost + LLAMaterialMtlCost + LLAMaterialSubCost + LLAMaterialBurCost).

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobAsmblRow.LLAMaterialMtlCost
member.summary: Lower Level Actual Material Material Cost. Depending on the setting of JCSyst.SplitMfgCostElements, if set to true then LLAMaterialMtlCost is the Total Material costs of all manufactured parts issued as material for the lower level (independent of LLAMaterialCost). Otherwise, LLAMaterialMtlCost is one of the component costs that makes up the LLAMaterialCost (i.e. LLAMaterialCost = LLAMaterialLabCost + LLAMaterialMtlCost + LLAMaterialSubCost + LLAMaterialBurCost).

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobAsmblRow.LLAMaterialSubCost
member.summary: Lower Level Actual Material Subcontract Cost. Depending on the setting of JCSyst.SplitMfgCostElements, if set to true then LLAMaterialSubCost is the Total Subcontract costs of all manufactured parts issued as material for the lower level (independent of LLAMaterialCost). Otherwise, LLAMaterialSubCost is one of the component costs that makes up the LLAMaterialCost (i.e. LLAMaterialCost = LLAMaterialLabCost + LLAMaterialMtlCost + LLAMaterialSubCost + LLAMaterialBurCost).

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobAsmblRow.LLAMaterialBurCost
member.summary: Lower Level Actual Material Burden Cost. Depending on the setting of JCSyst.SplitMfgCostElements, if set to true then LLAMaterialBurCost is the Total Burden costs of all manufactured parts issued as material for the lower level (independent of LLAMaterialCost). Otherwise, LLAMaterialBurCost is one of the component costs that makes up the LLAMaterialCost (i.e. LLAMaterialCost = LLAMaterialLabCost + LLAMaterialMtlCost + LLAMaterialSubCost + LLAMaterialBurCost).

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobAsmblRow.TotalMtlMtlCost
member.summary: Total Mtl cost to date. A summary of issue transactions - used track all costs for manufacured parts that were received into inventory then issued as material.. MaterialMtlCost + MaterialLabCost + MaterialSubCost + MaterialBurCost = TotalCost

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobAsmblRow.TotalMtlLabCost
member.summary: Total Lab cost to date from parts issued from inventory. A summary of issue transactions - used track all costs for manufacured parts that were received into inventory then issued as material.. IssuedMtlCost + IssuedLabCost + IssuedSubCost + IssuedBurCost = TotalCost

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobAsmblRow.TotalMtlSubCost
member.summary: Total Sub cost to date from part issued from inventory. A summary of issue transactions used track all costs for manufacured parts that were received into inventory then issued as material.. IssuedMtlCost + IssuedLabCost + IssuedSubCost + IssuedBurCost = TotalCost

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobAsmblRow.TotalMtlBurCost
member.summary: Total Burden cost to date from part issued from inventory. A summary of issue transactions - used track all costs for manufacured parts that were received into inventory then issued as material. IssuedMtlCost + IssuedLabCost + IssuedSubCost + IssuedBurCost = TotalCost

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobAsmblRow.CallNum
member.summary: The service call that this assembly belongs to.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobAsmblRow.CallLine
member.summary: The Service Call Line that this assembly relates to.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobAsmblRow.RestoreFlag
member.summary: Used to determine if this record was modified during the last What-If Schedule Restore. The contents are Date-Time. Example: "04/11/02-34221".

member.summary: Analysis Code

member.summary: The system time when the configuration was completed for the assembly.

member.summary: The User ID of the last user to complete the configuration of the assembly.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobAsmblRow.OrigRequiredQty

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobAsmblRow.UserMapData
member.summary: Character field that will contain the coma separated data that has been returned from Microsoft Projects. This data will be retained exactly as it was returned from MSP. This field will NOT be editable within Vantage.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobAsmblRow.WhseAllocFlag
member.summary: Indicates if the PartWhse allocation needs to be/has been updated by the new time delated process.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobAsmblRow.TLAMaterialMtlBurCost
member.summary: This Level Actual Material Mtl Burden Cost. Depending on the setting of JCSyst.SplitMfgCostElements, if set to true then TLAMaterialMtlBurCost is the Total Material Burden costs of all manufactured parts issued as material for this level. Otherwise, TLAMaterialMtlBurCost may be populated but is not included in the calculation of TLAMaterialCost.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobAsmblRow.LLAMaterialMtlBurCost
member.summary: Lower Level Actual Material Mtl Burden Cost. Depending on the setting of JCSyst.SplitMfgCostElements, if set to true then LLAMaterialMtlBurCost is the Total Material Burden costs of all manufactured parts issued as material for the lower level. Otherwise, LLAMaterialMtlBurCost may be populated but is not included in the calculation of LLAMaterialCost.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobAsmblRow.TLAMfgCompLabCost
member.summary: This Level Actual Component Labor Cost. This is the Total Labor costs of all manufactured parts issued as material for this level. Unlike TLAMaterialLabCost, this field will only store component costs that are from issued Mfg type materials used for this assembly.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobAsmblRow.TLAMfgCompMtlCost
member.summary: This Level Actual Component Material Cost. This is the Total Material costs of all manufactured parts issued as material for this level. Unlike TLAMaterialMtlCost, this field will only store component costs that are from issued Mfg type materials used for this assembly.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobAsmblRow.TLAMfgCompSubCost
member.summary: This Level Actual Component Subcontract Cost. This is the Total Subcontract costs of all manufactured parts issued as material for this level. Unlike TLAMaterialSubCost, this field will only store component costs that are from issued Mfg type materials used for this assembly.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobAsmblRow.TLAMfgCompBurCost
member.summary: This Level Actual Component Burden Cost. This is the Total Burden costs of all manufactured parts issued as material for this level. Unlike TLAMaterialBurCost, this field will only store component costs that are from issued Mfg type materials used for this assembly.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobAsmblRow.TLAMfgCompMtlBurCost
member.summary: This Level Actual Component Material Burden Cost. This is the Total Material Burden costs of all manufactured parts issued as material for this level. Unlike TLAMaterialMtlBurCost, this field will only store component costs that are from issued Mfg type materials used for this assembly.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobAsmblRow.LLAMfgCompLabCost
member.summary: Lower Level Actual Component Labor Cost. This is the Total Labor costs of all manufactured parts issued as material for the lower level. Unlike LLAMaterialLabCost, this field will only store component costs that are from issued Mfg type materials used for the lower assemblies.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobAsmblRow.LLAMfgCompMtlCost
member.summary: Lower Level Actual Component Material Cost. This is the Total Material costs of all manufactured parts issued as material for the lower level. Unlike LLAMaterialMtlCost, this field will only store component costs that are from issued Mfg type materials used for the lower assemblies.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobAsmblRow.LLAMfgCompSubCost
member.summary: Lower Level Actual Component Subcontract Cost. This is the Total Subcontract costs of all manufactured parts issued as material for the lower level. Unlike LLAMaterialSubCost, this field will only store component costs that are from issued Mfg type materials used for the lower assemblies.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobAsmblRow.LLAMfgCompBurCost
member.summary: Lower Level Actual Component Burden Cost. This is the Total Burden costs of all manufactured parts issued as material for the lower level. Unlike LLAMaterialBurCost, this field will only store component costs that are from issued Mfg type materials used for the lower assemblies.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobAsmblRow.LLAMfgCompMtlBurCost
member.summary: Lower Level Actual Component Material Burden Cost. This is the Total Material Burden costs of all manufactured parts issued as material for the lower level. Unlike LLAMaterialMtlBurCost, this field will only store component costs that are from issued Mfg type materials used for the lower assemblies.

member.summary: Original Rule Tag. Used in the Configurator.

member.summary: Validate Reference Designators.

member.summary: Base Part Number. Used in the configurator to identify the configurator part Number.

member.summary: Base Revision Number. Used in the configurator to identify the configurator part revision Number.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobAsmblRow.EstMtlUnitCost
member.summary: The estimated material unit cost component for the assembly quantity (JobAsmbl.PullQty) that will be pulled from inventory. Use the appropriate cost found in the Part file as a default. That is, select the cost fields based on Part.CostMethod. Then crossfoot the labor, burden and material into the EstUnitCost field. This field is a subcomponent of EstUnitCost where: EstUnitCost = EstMtlUnitCost + EstLbrUnitCost + EstBurunitCost + EstSubUnitCost.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobAsmblRow.EstLbrUnitCost
member.summary: The estimated labor unit cost component for the assembly quantity (JobAsmbl.PullQty) that will be pulled from inventory. Use the appropriate cost found in the Part file as a default. That is, select the cost fields based on Part.CostMethod. Then crossfoot the labor, burden and material into the EstUnitCost field. This field is a subcomponent of EstUnitCost where: EstUnitCost = EstMtlUnitCost + EstLbrUnitCost + EstBurunitCost + EstSubUnitCost.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobAsmblRow.EstBurUnitCost
member.summary: The estimated burden unit cost component for the assembly quantity (JobAsmbl.PullQty) that will be pulled from inventory. Use the appropriate cost found in the Part file as a default. That is, select the cost fields based on Part.CostMethod. Then crossfoot the labor, burden and material into the EstUnitCost field. This field is a subcomponent of EstUnitCost where: EstUnitCost = EstMtlUnitCost + EstLbrUnitCost + EstBurunitCost + EstSubUnitCost.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobAsmblRow.EstSubUnitCost
member.summary: The estimated burden unit cost component for the assembly quantity (JobAsmbl.PullQty) that will be pulled from inventory. Use the appropriate cost found in the Part file as a default. That is, select the cost fields based on Part.CostMethod. Then crossfoot the labor, burden and material into the EstUnitCost field. This field is a subcomponent of EstUnitCost where: EstUnitCost = EstMtlUnitCost + EstLbrUnitCost + EstBurunitCost + EstSubUnitCost.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobAsmblRow.PlanAsAsm
member.summary: Indicates if the sub-assemby can be spawned off to a different job. This can occur during the firming up of a job.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobAsmblRow.PAARef

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobAsmblRow.PAAFirm
member.summary: Used only on Plan As Assembly records. Indicates the sub assembly will be split of from the the current job and a separate job for the assembly will be created.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobAsmblRow.EstScrapType

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobAsmblRow.OrigStructTag
member.summary: When getting details on a multi-level configuration, the StructTag is used to load the configuration at each level so that method rules can be applied at that level. By storing the original StructTag of the configuration as it was defined under its parent, it speeds up the process of determining where the lower level configured was originally configured. If this field is populated, the lower level was originally configured as a child of another configured part.

member.summary: Company Identifier.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobMtlRow.JobComplete
member.summary: Indicates if "Job" is complete. This is a mirror image of JobHead.Complete. Not directly maintainable. When the Job is completed, then all JobMtl records are also marked. This is used to make database access to open material records more efficient.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobMtlRow.IssuedComplete
member.summary: Indicates if this material requirement has been issued complete. If "yes" then this record is NOT part of the Part.AllocQty total even if it had been issued less than the original required quantity. The user may toggle the setting if the JobHead.Complete is "NO". When it is toggled the allocation logic will be triggered if necessary.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobMtlRow.JobNum
member.summary: Job Number.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobMtlRow.AssemblySeq
member.summary: Assembly sequence number that this material is associated with.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobMtlRow.MtlSeq
member.summary: A sequence number that uniquely defines the Material (JobMtl) record within a specific Job/Assembly. This is system assigned. The next available number is determined by reading last JobMtl record on the Job/Assembly and then adding ten to it.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobMtlRow.PartNum
member.summary: Part number. If the material is being purchased (JobMtl.BuyIt = yes) this does need to be a valid part in the Part file.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobMtlRow.Description
member.summary: A description of the material.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobMtlRow.QtyPer
member.summary: Quantity per parent. Field Service was EstQty in FSCallMt.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobMtlRow.RequiredQty
member.summary: Required Quantity per END ITEM. This is a calculated field. Calculated as (Parent Required Qty X QtyPer) + calculated Scrap. The parent quantity is either the JobHead.ProdQty if JobMtl.AssemblySeq = 0 or (JobAsmbl.RequireQty - JobAsmbl.PullQty) if JobMtl.AssemblySeq > 0.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobMtlRow.IUM
member.summary: Internal unit of measure. The unit used to measure the material.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobMtlRow.LeadTime
member.summary: Expected purchasing lead time (in days). This field is only valid if JobMtl.BuyIt = yes. This can be used to calculate a suggested "Order By Date" based off the Required Date field. When scheduling the job, purchased material can push a schedule out if the material lead time prevents the material from being available when the operation could start.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobMtlRow.RelatedOperation
member.summary: A material record can be related to a specific operation. This field contains the JobOper.OprSeq of the operation that it is related to. It can be left as zero meaning that this material is required at the very beginning of the production job. The related operation is also used to calculate the JobMtl.ReqDate based on the operations scheduled start date and materials lead time.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobMtlRow.MtlBurRate
member.summary: The material burden rate for this Job Material.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobMtlRow.EstMtlBurUnitCost
member.summary: Estimated Material Burden Unit Cost of the material. Defaults from the Part table if valid PartNum.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobMtlRow.EstUnitCost
member.summary: Estimated Unit Cost of the material. Defaults from the Part table if valid PartNum.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobMtlRow.IssuedQty
member.summary: This quantity is a summary of all Issue Transactions. For FS this was FSCallMt.ActQty

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobMtlRow.TotalCost
member.summary: Total cost to date. A summary of issue transactions. This DOES NOT include the salvageable scrap credit amounts. FS - was UnitCost in FSCallMt

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobMtlRow.MtlBurCost
member.summary: Total Material Burden cost to date. A summary of issue transactions. This DOES NOT include the salvageable scrap credit amounts.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobMtlRow.ReqDate
member.summary: Mirror image of related operation (JobOper) or assembly (JobAsmbl) Start Date. (system maintained)

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobMtlRow.WarehouseCode
member.summary: The warehouse that the material is allocated against.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobMtlRow.SalvagePartNum
member.summary: Part number for salvageable scrap from this material record. An optional field. This does not have to be valid in the Part master. Salvage info is mainly to allow the credit back to a job for this type of scrap via salvage receipt process.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobMtlRow.SalvageDescription
member.summary: Description of Salvageable material. Use Part.Description for a default.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobMtlRow.SalvageQtyPer
member.summary: A factor that multiplied by the JobMtl.RequiredQty results in the expected total salvage quantity.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobMtlRow.SalvageUM
member.summary: Default unit of measure for the Salvaged Part. Default from the Part.IUM.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobMtlRow.SalvageMtlBurRate
member.summary: The salvage material burden rate for this Job Material.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobMtlRow.SalvageUnitCredit
member.summary: Estimated Salvage Unit Credit. Use the appropriate cost from the Part master as a default.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobMtlRow.SalvageEstMtlBurUnitCredit
member.summary: Estimated Salvage Mtl burden Unit Credit. Use the appropriate cost from the Part master as a default.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobMtlRow.SalvageQtyToDate
member.summary: This quantity is a summary of all transactions for receipt of salvage to inventory. This is not directly maintainable.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobMtlRow.SalvageCredit
member.summary: Total salvage credit to date. A summary of salvage receipt transactions.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobMtlRow.SalvageMtlBurCredit
member.summary: Total salvage Mtl Burden credit to date. A summary of salvage receipt transactions.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobMtlRow.MfgComment
member.summary: Comments for manufacturing about this material record. These comments are printed on manufacturing reports, such as the router. For valid Parts use the Part.MfgComment as a default. View as editor widget.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobMtlRow.VendorNum
member.summary: Used to identify a default vendor. Use the Part.VendorNum as a default. This will be used as a default for purchasing and miscellaneous receipts. This field is not directly maintainable, instead its assigned by having the user either entering the "VendorID" and then finding the VendorNum in the Vendor file or by selection list processing. An optional field, but if entered must be valid.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobMtlRow.PurPoint
member.summary: The Vendors Purchase Point ID. Along with the VendorNum is used to tie back to the VendorPP master file. Use the default purchase point defined in the Vendor file.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobMtlRow.BuyIt
member.summary: Indicates if this material is to be purchased for the Job. If this is a non inventory part then this is "Yes" and cannot be changed. If this is a valid Part then set it to "NO" but the user can override it. Material that is marked to be purchased (BuyIt = Yes) are NOT included in the PartWhse.AllocatedQty.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobMtlRow.Ordered
member.summary: FUTURE IMPLEMENTATION. This logical relates to material that is flagged to be purchased (BuyIt = Yes). When purchase orders are created for this job material requirement this flag is set to Yes indicating that a purchase order has been placed. The idea would be to use this within purchasing to quickly see the "direct job requirements" where no purchase orders have been placed.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobMtlRow.PurComment
member.summary: Comments for purchasing about this material record on this job. These comments will be used as defaults to the PODetail.Comment field when the purchase order references this JobMtl record. View as editor widget.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobMtlRow.BackFlush
member.summary: Indicates if this material will be backflushed. Note: this field is defaulted from Part.BackFlush Backflushing occurs via the write trigger on LaborDtl. The basic idea is to issue material based on the labor quantities reported. The formula for the issue quantity is: (JobMtl.RequiredQty/JobOper.RunQty) * (LaborDtl.LaborQty + LaborDtl.SrapQty).

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobMtlRow.EstScrap
member.summary: Estimated Scrap.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobMtlRow.EstScrapType
member.summary: Qualifies the EstScrapQty entry as being a fixed quantity or a percentage of required quantity.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobMtlRow.FixedQty
member.summary: Indicates if the QtyPer field represents a "Fixed Quantity". If Yes, then the required quantity = QtyPer. That is, the quantity does not change as the number of pieces being produced changes. This can be used to enter Tooling or Fixture type of requirements.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobMtlRow.FindNum
member.summary: Characters used on the drawing to show where material is used.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobMtlRow.RevisionNum
member.summary: The revision number for the material. An optional field. Defaults from the most current PartRev.RevisionNum.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobMtlRow.SndAlrtCmpl
member.summary: Controls if an alert is to be sent when this JobMtl is completed.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobMtlRow.RcvInspectionReq
member.summary: Indicates if inspection is required when items are received to this JobMtl. Inspection may also be enforced if the related PartClass, Vendor, PODetail have their "RcvInspectionReq" fields set to Yes.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobMtlRow.Plant
member.summary: Site Identifier.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobMtlRow.Direct
member.summary: Indicates if this material requirement is going to be satisfied by another job (possibly in another Site), as opposed to a warehouse. If "yes" a WarehouseCode will not be specified.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobMtlRow.MaterialMtlCost
member.summary: Total Mtl cost to date. A summary of issue transactions - used track all costs for manufacured parts that were received into inventory then issued as material.. MaterialMtlCost + MaterialLabCost + MaterialSubCost + MaterialBurCost = TotalCost

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobMtlRow.MaterialLabCost
member.summary: Total Lab cost to date from parts issued from inventory. A summary of issue transactions - used track all costs for manufacured parts that were received into inventory then issued as material.. IssuedMtlCost + IssuedLabCost + IssuedSubCost + IssuedBurCost = TotalCost

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobMtlRow.MaterialSubCost
member.summary: Total Sub cost to date from part issued from inventory. A summary of issue transactions used track all costs for manufacured parts that were received into inventory then issued as material.. IssuedMtlCost + IssuedLabCost + IssuedSubCost + IssuedBurCost = TotalCost

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobMtlRow.MaterialBurCost
member.summary: Total Bur cost to date from part issued from inventory. A summary of issue transactions - used track all costs for manufacured parts that were received into inventory then issued as material. IssuedMtlCost + IssuedLabCost + IssuedSubCost + IssuedBurCost = TotalCost

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobMtlRow.SalvageMtlCredit
member.summary: Total salvage Mtl credit to date. A summary of salvage receipt transactions. SalvageCredit = SalvageMtlCredit + SalvageLbrCredit + SalvageBurCredit + SalvageSubCredit

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobMtlRow.SalvageLbrCredit
member.summary: Total salvage Lbr credit to date. A summary of salvage receipt transactions. SalvageCredit = SalvageMtlCredit + SalvageLbrCredit + SalvageBurCredit + SalvageSubCredit

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobMtlRow.SalvageBurCredit
member.summary: Total salvage Burden credit to date. A summary of salvage receipt transactions. SalvageCredit = SalvageMtlCredit + SalvageLbrCredit + SalvageBurCredit + SalvageSubCredit

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobMtlRow.SalvageSubCredit
member.summary: Total salvage Subcontract credit to date. A summary of salvage receipt transactions. SalvageCredit = SalvageMtlCredit + SalvageLbrCredit + SalvageBurCredit + SalvageSubCredit

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobMtlRow.APSAddResType
member.summary: Advanced Planning and Scheduling Additional Resource Type. Indicates whether the Part should be treated as an AdditionalResourceType by eScheduler. 'I' to ignore in eScheduler 'M' to treat at Material in eScheduler 'A' to treat as AddResType in eScheduler

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobMtlRow.CallNum
member.summary: The service call that this Material belongs to.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobMtlRow.CallLine
member.summary: The Service Call Line that this material relates to.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobMtlRow.ProdCode
member.summary: Product Group Code. Use the Part.ProdCode as a default. This can be blank or must be valid in the ProdGrup table.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobMtlRow.UnitPrice
member.summary: FS - Unit Price for the Material in base currency.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobMtlRow.BillableUnitPrice
member.summary: FS - Billable Unit Price for the Material in base currency.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobMtlRow.DocBillableUnitPrice
member.summary: FS - Billable Price per unit for the material in customers currency.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobMtlRow.ResReasonCode
member.summary: Problem reason code from the reason master table. type Service call.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobMtlRow.PricePerCode
member.summary: Indicates the pricing per quantity for this part. It can be "E" = per each,"C" = per hundred, "M" = per thousand. Maintainable only via Part Maintenance. The initial default is "E".

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobMtlRow.Billable
member.summary: Is this a billable material item.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobMtlRow.ShippedQty
member.summary: Holds the quantity of the item that has been shipped through misc. shipments

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobMtlRow.DocUnitPrice
member.summary: FS - Unit Price for the Material in Customer currency.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobMtlRow.QtyStagedToDate
member.summary: The todate quantity that has been moved to the work centers input Warehouse/Bin. This is NOT A balance. It is a todate value. It is not reduced as it is consumed. Used in calculation of "Outstanding" material in the Request Material program (ame30-dg.w). Only updated if the Advanced Material Mgmt module is installed and only by transactions which "move" the material in/out of the staging area(Issues,Returns).

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobMtlRow.AddedMtl
member.summary: This material was added after initial setup of the job

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobMtlRow.MiscCharge
member.summary: This indicates that this JobMtl record is for a Misc charge related to this job/assembly.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobMtlRow.MiscCode
member.summary: The Miscellaneous Charge Code. This must be valid in the PurMisc master file. It must be a AP Misc. charge.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobMtlRow.SCMiscCode
member.summary: The Miscellaneous Charge Code for Service Call billing. This must be valid in the MiscChrg master file. It must be a AR Misc. charge.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobMtlRow.RFQNeeded
member.summary: A flag to indicate that this job material requires an RFQ. If it does require an RFQ, the user must enter the number of vendor quotes that are required.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobMtlRow.RFQVendQuotes
member.summary: The number of vendor quotes that are required for this job material. Can be zero if RFQ(s) are not required.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobMtlRow.RFQNum
member.summary: RFQ number that the item is linked to.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobMtlRow.RFQLine
member.summary: The line number of this detail record on the RFQ. This number uniquely identifies the record within the RFQ. The number is not directly maintainable, it's assigned by the system when records are created.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobMtlRow.RFQStat
member.summary: RFQ Status. W= Waiting, A = Accepted, R = Requested, C = Received

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobMtlRow.AnalysisCode
member.summary: Analysis Code

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobMtlRow.GlbRFQ
member.summary: Global RFQ flag. Used in Consolidated Purchasing.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobMtlRow.WhseAllocFlag
member.summary: Indicates if the PartWhse allocation needs to be/has been updated by the new time delated process.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobMtlRow.WIReqDate
member.summary: Mirror image of related operation (JobOper) or assembly (JobAsmbl) Start Date. (system maintained)

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobMtlRow.Rpt1BillableUnitPrice
member.summary: Reporting currency value of this field

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobMtlRow.Rpt2BillableUnitPrice
member.summary: Reporting currency value of this field

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobMtlRow.Rpt3BillableUnitPrice
member.summary: Reporting currency value of this field

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobMtlRow.Rpt1UnitPrice
member.summary: Reporting currency value of this field

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobMtlRow.Rpt2UnitPrice
member.summary: Reporting currency value of this field

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobMtlRow.Rpt3UnitPrice
member.summary: Reporting currency value of this field

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobMtlRow.BaseRequiredQty
member.summary: Required Quantity in the Parts Base UOM. Set by the system by doing a UOM conversion of the JobMtl.RequiredQty which is in the UOM of the requirement to the JobMtl.BaseUOM which is the UOM of the Part and it's unit costs. This quantity multiplied by the JobMtl.EstMtlUnitCost is used to update the total estimated costs found in JobAsmbl.TLEMaterialCost

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobMtlRow.BaseUOM
member.summary: Unit of Measure of the JobMtl.BaseRequiredQty. If valid part, then it is the Parts Primary Inventory UOM otherwise it is the same as JobMtl.IUM

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobMtlRow.Weight
member.summary: Material Weight defaulted from Part Master.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobMtlRow.WeightUOM
member.summary: Material Weight UOM defaulted from Part Master.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobMtlRow.ReqRefDes
member.summary: Required number of designators

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobMtlRow.BasePartNum
member.summary: Base Part Number. Used in the configurator to identify the configurator part Number.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobMtlRow.BaseRevisionNum
member.summary: Base Revision Number. Used in the configurator to identify the configurator part revision Number.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobMtlRow.SelectForPicking
member.summary: Indicates if the job material is selected to be submitted to the picking queue. When submitted for picking a record is written to the MtlQueue table and then SelectForPicking is reset to NO.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobMtlRow.StagingWarehouseCode
member.summary: The job pick "Staging" warehouse for the job material. Defaults from the system default warehouse (PlantConfCtrl.DefJobPickWhse).

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobMtlRow.StagingBinNum
member.summary: The job pick "Staging" bin for the job material. Defaults from the system default bin (PlantConfCtrl.DefJobPickBin).

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobMtlRow.PickError
member.summary: A non blank character indicates that the release could not be picked by the Auto Pick process. The possible values are; "L" - Order Line can't be shipped complete. "O" - Order can't be shipped complete. "I" - Insufficient quantity reserved "Z" - Zero quantity reserved.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobMtlRow.EstMtlUnitCost
member.summary: Estimated Material Unit Cost component of the EstUnitCost. Defaults from the Part table if valid PartNum. This field will only have value if the part is a manufactured stock part. This is a subcomponent of the EstUnitCost where: EstUnitCost = EstMtlUnitCost + EstLbrUnitCost + EstBurUnitCost + EstSubUnitCost.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobMtlRow.EstLbrUnitCost
member.summary: Estimated Labor Unit Cost component of the EstUnitCost. Defaults from the Part table if valid PartNum. This field will only have value if the part is a manufactured stock part. This is a subcomponent of the EstUnitCost where: EstUnitCost = EstMtlUnitCost + EstLbrUnitCost + EstBurUnitCost + EstSubUnitCost.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobMtlRow.EstBurUnitCost
member.summary: Estimated Burden Unit Cost component of the EstUnitCost. Defaults from the Part table if valid PartNum. This field will only have value if the part is a manufactured stock part. This is a subcomponent of the EstUnitCost where: EstUnitCost = EstMtlUnitCost + EstLbrUnitCost + EstBurUnitCost + EstSubUnitCost.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobMtlRow.EstSubUnitCost
member.summary: Estimated Subcontract Unit Cost component of the EstUnitCost. Defaults from the Part table if valid PartNum. This field will only have value if the part is a manufactured stock part. This is a subcomponent of the EstUnitCost where: EstUnitCost = EstMtlUnitCost + EstLbrUnitCost + EstBurUnitCost + EstSubUnitCost.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobMtlRow.SalvageEstMtlUnitCredit
member.summary: Estimated Salvage Material Unit Credit. Use the appropriate cost from the Part master as a default. This is a subcomponent of the field SalvageUnitCredit where: SalvageUnitCredit = SalvageEstMtlUnitCredit + SalvageEstLbrUnitCredit + SalvageEstBurUnitCredit + SalvageEstSubUnitCredit.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobMtlRow.SalvageEstLbrUnitCredit
member.summary: Estimated Salvage Labor Unit Credit. Use the appropriate cost from the Part master as a default. This is a subcomponent of the field SalvageUnitCredit where: SalvageUnitCredit = SalvageEstMtlUnitCredit + SalvageEstLbrUnitCredit + SalvageEstBurUnitCredit + SalvageEstSubUnitCredit.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobMtlRow.SalvageEstBurUnitCredit
member.summary: Estimated Salvage Burden Unit Credit. Use the appropriate cost from the Part master as a default. This is a subcomponent of the field SalvageUnitCredit where: SalvageUnitCredit = SalvageEstMtlUnitCredit + SalvageEstLbrUnitCredit + SalvageEstBurUnitCredit + SalvageEstSubUnitCredit.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobMtlRow.SalvageEstSubUnitCredit
member.summary: Estimated Salvage Subcontract Unit Credit. Use the appropriate cost from the Part master as a default. This is a subcomponent of the field SalvageUnitCredit where: SalvageUnitCredit = SalvageEstMtlUnitCredit + SalvageEstLbrUnitCredit + SalvageEstBurUnitCredit + SalvageEstSubUnitCredit.

member.summary: Unique identifier for this row. The value is a GUID.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobMtlRow.OrigStructTag
member.summary: When getting details on a multi-level configuration, the StructTag is used to load the configuration at each level so that method rules can be applied at that level. By storing the original StructTag of the configuration as it was defined under its parent, it speeds up the process of determining where the lower level configured was originally configured. If this field is populated, the lower level was originally configured as a child of another configured part.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobMtlRow.OrigGroupSeq
member.summary: By storing the original Group Sequence of the configuration as it was defined under its parent, it speeds up the process of determining where the lower level configured was originally configured. If this field is populated, the lower level was originally configured as a child of another configured part.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOperRow.Company
member.summary: Company Identifier.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOperRow.JobComplete
member.summary: Indicates if "Job" is complete. This is a mirror image of JobHead.Complete. Not directly maintainable. When the Job is completed, then all JobOper records are also marked. This is used to make database access to open operation records more efficient.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOperRow.OpComplete
member.summary: Indicates if this operation is completed. This is normally set to complete via labor entry transactions. Not maintainable by Job Entry. It can't be reset to "No" if the JobHead.Complete = Yes. Labor entry setting logic is: If SetUpComplete = Yes and EstProdHours = 0 or ProdComplete = Yes and EstSetHours = 0 or both ProdComplete = Yes and SetupComplete = Yes then OpComplete = Yes. This field is also set by PO receipt entry "issue complete" for subcontract operations.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOperRow.JobNum
member.summary: Job Number

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOperRow.AssemblySeq
member.summary: Assembly Sequence # that this Operation is associated with.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOperRow.OprSeq
member.summary: A sequence number which uniquely identifies the operation record within the Job/lot/level. The sequence can be system generated or assigned by user. System generated numbers are determined by reading last JobOper for the job/lot/level and then figures out what the next number that is divisible by 10. If this number is within 3 of the last Number on file it will be bumped up another 10. This keeps a minimum of 2 available sequences between records. For example if last = 18 Next would be 30, If last = 17 next = 20.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOperRow.OpCode
member.summary: Operation Master Code - Links the JobOper record with a OpMaster record. Default is given from WrkCenter.OpCode. Must be valid in the OpMaster file.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOperRow.OpStdID
member.summary: The Operation standard ID. This links the JobOper to the OpStd master file. This can be blank or if entered must be valid if entered. When this field is changed the ProdStandard, StdFormat and StdBasis should be refreshed with the new defaults. Valid for "inside operations" only.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOperRow.EstSetHours
member.summary: Total estimated set up hours. Calculated as EstSetHoursPerMch * Machines. It is set to zero if operation qty is zero. This is maintained via the JobOper write trigger.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOperRow.EstProdHours
member.summary: The estimated Production run hours for internal operations (JobOper.Subcontract = No) . This is not directly maintainable. It exists so that it will be easier to display than always having to recalculate it when it is needed. It is calculated using the ProdStandard, StdFormat, StdBasis, OpsPerPart, QtyPer, EstScrap and EstScrapType. FORMULAS: If StdFormat = "HR" then EstProdHours = ProdStandard. If StdFormat = "PH" then (JobOper.RunQty / Std). If StdFormat = "PM" then (JobOper.RunQty / Std ) / 60. If StdFormat = "OH" then (JobOper.RunQty/OpsPerPart) / Std. If StdFormat = "OM" then ((JobOper.RunQty/OpsPerPart) / Std) / 60. If StdFormat = "HP" then (JobOPer.RunQty/Basis) X Std. If StdFormat = "MP" then ((JobOper.RunQty/Basis) X Std) / 60.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOperRow.ProdStandard
member.summary: The production standard for the operation. It can be expressed as Hours, Minutes per piece, Pieces per Time, Operations per Minute or Operations per hour. This along with the StdFormat, StdBasis, OpsPer and fields are used to calculate the operations estimated production hours. A value can be defaulted from the OpStd master. NOTE: The ProdStandard can only be zero if the EstSetHours are greater than zero.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOperRow.StdFormat
member.summary: Qualifier for the Production Standard field. This is used as a default to the qualifier field in operation details. The valid qualifiers are; "HP" - Hours/Piece, "MP" - minutes/piece, "PH" - pieces/hour, "PM" - Pieces/Minute, "OH" - Operations/Hour, "OM" - Operations/minute, HR - Fixed Hours.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOperRow.StdBasis
member.summary: A standard basis is to be used to with standards that are time per piece (HP & MP). The basis is a Divisor. Valid codes are E-Eaches, C=100's, M=1000's, T=10,000. This field is used in the formula for calculating the estimated production hours. The operation quantity is divided by the basis value and then multiplied by the standard to result in hours.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOperRow.OpsPerPart
member.summary: Number of operations per part. This is used in the calculation of the estimated production hours when the StdFormat is "OM" or "OH". This should not be accessible if StdFormat is not "OM" or "OH". It MUST BE > 0 if StdFormat is "OM" or "OH".

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOperRow.QtyPer
member.summary: Production Quantity per one of the Parent Item.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOperRow.QueStartDate
member.summary: Scheduled queue start date. Not directly maintainable, updated via the scheduling process.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOperRow.QueStartHour
member.summary: Scheduled queue start hour offset from the beginning of the work day. This field is established by scheduling.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOperRow.StartDate
member.summary: Scheduled production start date. Not directly maintainable, updated via the scheduling process.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOperRow.StartHour
member.summary: This field is established by scheduling. It represents the "Hour offset from the beginning of the work day" when this operation is scheduled to begin.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOperRow.DueDate
member.summary: Scheduled production due date. Not directly maintainable, updated via the scheduling process.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOperRow.DueHour
member.summary: This field is established by scheduling. It represents the "Hour offset from the beginning of the work day" when this operation is scheduled to end.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOperRow.MoveDueDate
member.summary: Scheduled move due date. Not directly maintainable, updated via the scheduling process.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOperRow.MoveDueHour
member.summary: Scheduled move due hour offset from the beginning of the work day. This field is established by scheduling.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOperRow.ProdLabRate
member.summary: Labor rate used for estimated production labor costs. Default from the OpMaster.ProdLabRate.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOperRow.SetupLabRate
member.summary: Labor rate for estimated setup labor costs. Default from the OpMaster.SetupLabRate.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOperRow.ProdBurRate
member.summary: The burden rate to be used for the production time on this operation. (EstProdHrs X ProdBurRate). Default from the WrkCenter.ProdBurRate.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOperRow.SetupBurRate
member.summary: The burden rate to be used for the Setup time on this operation. (EstSetHours X ProdBurRate). Default from the WrkCenter.SetupBurRate.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOperRow.AddedOper
member.summary: This indicates if this is an "added operation". An added operation is one that was not planned on.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOperRow.Machines
member.summary: Defaulted from the WrkCenter.SchMachines field. This is the number of machines that this operation will run on at the same time. Logically thought of as a "Squeeze factor" to scheduling. That is the more machines, the shorter the schedule. This affects how much of the total daily workcenter capacity that the operation will consume. For example; Center has 4 machines, 8 Hours per day and operation 2 machines. This operation would consume 16 hours of capacity per day. So if it had 32 hours of estimated production it would schedule as taking 2 days. NOTE THIS ONLY APPLIES TO PRODUCTION HOURS, TOTAL SETUP HOURS ARE ADDED TO THE SQUEEZED PRODUCTION HOURS TO GET THE NUMBER OF HOURS TO BE SCHEDULED. It is however used to calculate the total setup hours on the operation.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOperRow.SetUpCrewSize
member.summary: Defaulted from the WrkCenter.SetUpCrewSize field. Its the number of people it physically takes to setup this operation. It is used as a multiplier in the estimated labor hours calculation. JobOper.EstSetHours * JobOper.SetUpCrewSize = Estimated Labor hours for the operation. This also affects the estimated labor cost. Est Cost = Est Labor Hours * SetUpLaborRate

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOperRow.ProdCrewSize
member.summary: Defaults from the WrkCenter.ProdCrewSize. The # of people it physically takes to perform the production on this operation per machine that it is run on. CrewSize * JobOper.EstProdHours = Est. Prod. Labor Hours. Note this can be a fraction for operations that do not require full time attention of an employee. See also SetUpCrewSize

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOperRow.ProdComplete
member.summary: A flag indicating if the production is complete for this operation. It is updated via Labor Entry.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOperRow.SetupComplete
member.summary: Flag that indicates if Setup is complete on this operation. This flag is only used when the operation has EstSetupHours > 0.00.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOperRow.ActProdHours
member.summary: Total Actual Production Hours. A summary of non-setup LaborDtl.BurdenHrs. This includes REWORK hours. This is maintained via write/delete triggers on the LaborDtl file. Along with JobOper.ActReworkHours it is used to reduce the shop load if the system is configured to remove load by actual hours (JCSyst.RemoveLoad = "H").

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOperRow.ActProdRwkHours
member.summary: Total Actual Production Rework Hours. A summary of rework labor transactions (LaborDtl.BurdenHrs) where LaborDtl.LaborType = "P" and Rework = Yes. This number is also included as part of the JobOPer.ActProdHours. Maintained via write/delete triggers on the LaborDtl file. Along with JobOper.ActProdHours it is used to reduce the shop load if the system is configured to remove load by actual hours (JCSyst.RemoveLoad = "H"). (See the lib/inopload.i code for load remaining logic)

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOperRow.ActSetupHours
member.summary: Actual setup hours. A summary of setup (LaborDtl.LaborType = S) labor transactions hours (LaborDtl.Burden). Actual Setup hours reduce the shop load if the system is configured to remove load based on hours (JCSyst.RemoveLoad = "H").

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOperRow.ActSetupRwkHours
member.summary: Total Actual Setup Rework Hours. A summary of rework labor transactions (LaborDtl.BurdenHrs) where LaborDtl.LaborType = "S" and Rework = Yes. This number is also included as part of the JobOPer.ActSetupHours. Maintained via write/delete triggers on the LaborDtl file. Along with JobOper.ActSetHours it is used to reduce the shop load if the system is configured to remove load by actual hours (JCSyst.RemoveLoad = "H"). (See the lib/inopload.i code for load remaining logic)

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOperRow.QtyCompleted
member.summary: For Non Subcontract operations: A summary of labor transaction detail. (LaborDtl.LaborQty). Labor entry/collection maintains this field. Only the LaborQty for transactions that are Production labor ( LaborType = P ) and Not rework (LaborDtl.Rework = No) are included in this summary. This quantity is used to reduce shop load when the system is configured to reduce load based on quantity completed. (JCSyst.RemoveLoad = Q) For Subcontract Operations this field is updated by the Purchased Receipt process. The detail records are in the PartTran file.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOperRow.SetupPctComplete
member.summary: Setup function percent complete. Maintained via labor entry.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOperRow.EstScrap
member.summary: EstScrap = a number representing either a scrap qty or a scrap percent depending on the value of EstScrapType field.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOperRow.EstScrapType
member.summary: Qualifies the ScrapQty entry as being a fixed quantity or a percentage of run quantity.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOperRow.SubContract
member.summary: This flags the operation as being a "SubContract" or an "Internal" operation. This also controls what fields are allowed to be updated for this record. For example, an internal operation will not have a PartNum.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOperRow.IUM
member.summary: Inventory UOM

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOperRow.EstUnitCost
member.summary: Estimated Unit Cost for the SubContract operation. Defaults from the Part table if valid PartNum.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOperRow.DaysOut
member.summary: Hours required is calculated as days * 8.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOperRow.PartNum
member.summary: The PartNum to be shipped to the subcontract. Default the JobHead.PartNum or JobAsmbl.PartNum depending on the JobMtl.AssemblySeq.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOperRow.Description
member.summary: Description used only for subcontract operations

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOperRow.VendorNum
member.summary: The SubContractors VendorNum that ties back to the Vendor master file. This is only valid for "SubContract" operations. This field is not directly maintainable, instead its assigned by having the user either enter the "VendorID" and then finding the VendorNum in the Vendor file or by selection list processing. This is a mandatory entry for subcontract operations.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOperRow.PurPoint
member.summary: The Vendors purchase point ID. This field is only for the "Subcontract" operations. Along with the VendorNum is used to tie back to the VendorPP master file. Use the default Purchase point defined in the Vendor file.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOperRow.CommentText
member.summary: Editor widget for Job operation comments.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOperRow.SchedRelation
member.summary: Indicates the scheduling relationship between this and the preceding operation. Possible values are "SS" - Start to Start, "FS" Finish to Start or "FF" Finish to Finish. A "SS" can start when the preceding operation starts. A "FS" starts when the preceding operation is finished. A "FF" can finish when the preceding operation finishes. These relationships do not span between levels of assemblies. The first operation on an assembly is always treated as being "FS" relationship. A "FF" finishes when the preceding operation is finished.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOperRow.RunQty
member.summary: The total operation quantity. This is a calculated field. Calculated as (Assembly Required Qty X QtyPer) + Scrap. The assembly qty is either the JobHead.ProdQty if JobOPer.AssemblySeq = 0 or (JobAsmbl.RequireQty - JobAsmbl.PullQty) if JobOPer.AssemblySeq > 0. This value is refreshed when maintenance is performed on the operation record or an assemblies production qty is changed

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOperRow.WIName
member.summary: This field is blank or contains the UserID. When not blank it indicates that the operations schedule has been changed and is considered as being in a "What If" mode. This field is also used as part of an index which allows the system to quickly find the operations that need to be reset to "Actual Schedule".

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOperRow.WIMachines
member.summary: This is the What-If number of machines that this operation will run on at the same time. Setup by and for scheduling from the Machines field.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOperRow.WIQueStartDate
member.summary: What-if Scheduled queue start date. Not directly maintainable, updated via the scheduling process.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOperRow.WIQueStartHour
member.summary: What-if Scheduled queue start hour offset from the beginning of the work day. This field is established by scheduling.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOperRow.WIStartDate
member.summary: What if Scheduled production start date. Not directly maintainable, updated via the scheduling process.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOperRow.WIStartHour
member.summary: This field is established by scheduling. It represents the What If "Hour offset from the beginning of the work day" when this operation is scheduled to begin.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOperRow.WIDueDate
member.summary: What If Scheduled production due date. Not directly maintainable, updated via the scheduling process.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOperRow.WIDueHour
member.summary: This field is established by scheduling. It represents the "Hour offset from the beginning of the work day" when this operation is scheduled to end.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOperRow.WIMoveDueDate
member.summary: What-If Scheduled move due date. Not directly maintainable, updated via the scheduling process.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOperRow.WIMoveDueHour
member.summary: What-if Scheduled move due hour offset from the beginning of the work day. This field is established by scheduling.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOperRow.WIHoursPerMachine
member.summary: The Number of Hours per machine per day that this operations "What If" schedule is based on. This is for "Inbetween" days, not first or last days. It is a copy of WrkCenter.HoursPerMachine field at the time of scheduling. Used in logic of maintaining ShopLoad records.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOperRow.WILoadDate
member.summary: Date at which the operations current outstanding "What-If" load starts at. Updated by the JobOper write trigger. (See LoadDate)

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOperRow.WILoadHour
member.summary: "Hour offset from the beginning of the work day" for the operations outstanding "What-If" load. Related to WILoadDate.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOperRow.ActBurCost
member.summary: Total Burden cost to date. This is update via the LaborDtl\Write.p trigger procedure. It includes ALL burden costs (Setup, Production and Rework)

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOperRow.ActLabCost
member.summary: FOR NON-SUBCONTRACT OPERATIONS: Total of "ALL" labor costs to date. This includes Setup, Production and Rework. Updated via the LaborDtl.Write.p trigger. FOR SUBCONTRACT OPERATIONS: The Total Cost, updated via the receipt process.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOperRow.ReworkBurCost
member.summary: Total Rework Burden cost todate. This value is also included in the ActBurCost total. It includes both setup & production rework. Updated via LaborDtl\Write.P trigger.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOperRow.ReworkLabCost
member.summary: Total Rework Labor cost to date. This value is also included in the ActLabCost field. This includes both Setup & Production. Updated via the LaborDtl\Write.p trigger.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOperRow.MiscAmt
member.summary: A total additional charge that is incurred when purchasing this service. Ex(Lot,Setup,Handling,etc...). Defaulted from VendPart.MiscAmt. This is NOT part of the a Unit Cost. It is NOT consider in the logic of using Minimum Cost.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOperRow.HoursPerMachine
member.summary: The Number of Hours per machine per day that this operations "actual" schedule is based on. This is for "Inbetween" days, not first or last days. It is a copy of WrkCenter.HoursPerMachine field at the time of scheduling. Used in logic of maintaining the ShopLoad records.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOperRow.LoadDate
member.summary: Date at which the operations current outstanding load starts at. Ex: Op schedule is 2/1/97 - 2/10/97, initially LoadDate = 2/1/97. As load is relieved through labor processing the LoadDate moves forward accordingly. When 1/2 completed the LoadDate would be 2/5/97. This field is primarily used by the Scheduling Board to calculate the graphical image of outstanding load. Updated by the JobOper write trigger.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOperRow.LoadHour
member.summary: "Hour offset from the beginning of the work day" for the operations outstanding load. Related to LoadDate.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOperRow.ReloadNum
member.summary: Internally used field to prevent redundant read of JobOper during execution of "Reloader" program. (See WrkCenter.ReloadNum)

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOperRow.SndAlrtCmpl
member.summary: Controls if an alert is to be sent when this JobOper is completed.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOperRow.RcvInspectionReq
member.summary: Indicates if Inspection is required when items are received to this JobOper (subcontract only). Inspection may also be enforced if the related PartClass, Vendor, PODetail have their "RcvInspectionReq" fields set to Yes.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOperRow.JobEngineered
member.summary: Identical to JobHead.JobEngineered. ShopLoad capacity is only allocated to Jobs where JobEngineered = YES.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOperRow.EstSetHoursPerMch
member.summary: The estimated set up hours per machine. Default from OpStd.SetupHours. Used to calculate JobOper.EstSetupHours.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOperRow.RevisionNum
member.summary: Part Revision number. Pertains to subcontracting operations only. An optional field. Related JobAsmbl.RevisionNum is used as the default.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOperRow.AutoReceiptDate
member.summary: Currently not used. Prep for future development.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOperRow.LastLaborDate
member.summary: The labor date of the last labor transaction that was posted to this operation. Used by the JobOper write trigger Auto Receieve logic.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOperRow.CallNum
member.summary: The service call that this operation belongs to.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOperRow.CallLine
member.summary: The Service Call Line that this operation relates to.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOperRow.LaborRate
member.summary: Labor rate used for time on an operation. Time per hour per technician. in base currency.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOperRow.BillableLaborRate
member.summary: Billable Labor rate used for time on a service. Time per hour per technician. in base currency. This field considers the percentage coverage of a warranty or contract.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOperRow.DocLaborRate
member.summary: Labor rate used for time on a service. Time per hour per technician. In Customer currency. Does not consider warranty or contract

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOperRow.DocBillableLaborRate
member.summary: Billable Labor rate used for time on a service. Time per hour per technician. In Customer currency. considers warranty or contract

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOperRow.Billable
member.summary: FS - Is this a billable operation.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOperRow.UnitPrice
member.summary: FS - Unit Price for the subcontract in base currency.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOperRow.BillableUnitPrice
member.summary: FS - Billable Unit Price for the subcontract in base currency.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOperRow.DocBillableUnitPrice
member.summary: FS - Billable Price per unit for the subcontract in customers currency.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOperRow.DocUnitPrice
member.summary: FS - Unit Price for the for the Subcontract in Customer currency.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOperRow.LaborEntryMethod
member.summary: Indicates the Method for Labor Entry. Can be "T" - Time and Quantity, "Q" - Quantity Only (Time is estimated), "B" - Backflush or "X" - Time - Backflush Qty.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOperRow.PricePerCode
member.summary: Indicates the pricing per quantity for this part. It can be "E" = per each,"C" = per hundred, "M" = per thousand. Maintainable only via Part Maintenance. The initial default is "E".

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOperRow.FAQty
member.summary: The quantity requested for first article inspection.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOperRow.QtyStagedToDate
member.summary: The "to date" quantity that has been moved to the input Warehouse/Bin of the subsequent operations ResourceGroup/Resource input Warehouse/Bin. This is NOT A balance. It is a "to date" value. It is not reduced as it is consumed. Used in calculation of "Outstanding" WIP in the Request Material/WIP program (ame30-dg.w). Only updated if the Advanced Material Mgmt module is installed and only by transactions which "move" the WIP material in/out of the staging area (Issues, Returns).

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOperRow.RFQNeeded
member.summary: A flag to indicate that this job operation requires an RFQ. If it does require an RFQ, the user must enter the number of vendor quotes that are required. This only applies to subcontract operations.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOperRow.RFQVendQuotes
member.summary: The number of vendor quotes that are required for this job subcontract operation. Can be zero if RFQ(s) are not required.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOperRow.RFQNum
member.summary: RFQ number that the item is linked to.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOperRow.RFQLine
member.summary: The line number of this detail record on the RFQ. This number uniquely identifies the record within the RFQ. The number is not directly maintainable, it's assigned by the system when records are created.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOperRow.RFQStat
member.summary: RFQ Status. W= Waiting, A = Accepted, R = Requested, C = Received

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOperRow.SetupGroup
member.summary: Used to group operation to save on setups.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOperRow.RestoreFlag
member.summary: Used to determine if this record was modified during the last What-If Schedule Restore. The contents are Date-Time. Example: "04/11/02-34221".

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOperRow.AnalysisCode
member.summary: Analysis Code

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOperRow.PrimarySetupOpDtl
member.summary: Identifies the primary JobOpDtl to be used for setup. The setup time for the operation is determined on the JobOpDtl. If <> 0, must identify a valid JobOpDtl. The JobOpDtl needs to have a RequiredFor = S or B.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOperRow.PrimaryProdOpDtl
member.summary: Identifies the primary JobOpDtl to be used for production. The production run time for the operation is determined on the JobOpDtl. If <> 0, must identify a valid JobOpDtl. The JobOpDtl needs to have a RequiredFor = P or B.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOperRow.OpDesc
member.summary: Operation Description.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOperRow.KitDate
member.summary: Kit Date. Not directly maintanable. Updated via the scheduling process.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOperRow.GlbRFQ
member.summary: Global RFQ flag. Used in Consolidated Purchasing.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOperRow.BookedUnitCost
member.summary: Booked Unit Cost

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOperRow.RecalcExpProdYld
member.summary: Initially defaulted to false. This flag is set to true at the time JobOper.ProdComplete is set to true if JobHead.ProductionYield = true and OpMaster. PrdYldRecalcExpected = true and the actual completed qty for the operation vs. the expected completion qty is out of variance based on the under percentage set in OpMaster. This flag is used by the production yield recalculation logic to determine if recalculation is required for a job. This field is maintained by the system only.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOperRow.UserMapData
member.summary: Character field that will contain the coma separated data that has been returned from Microsoft Projects. This data will be retained exactly as it was returned from MSP. This field will NOT be editable within Vantage.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOperRow.RoughCutSched
member.summary: When true this would signify that this operation was rough cut scheduled - meaning the operation would have start and end dates but no supporting resourcetimeused or shopload records.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOperRow.SchedComment
member.summary: Scheduling Comments
