member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOperRow.SNRequiredOpr
member.summary: Indicates whether serial numbers are required form this operation. When true the system will prompt in labor entry processes for the serial numbers that have been completed on this operation.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOperRow.SNRequiredSubConShip
member.summary: Indicates whether serial numbers are required on subcontract ship for a subcontract operation.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOperRow.Weight
member.summary: Operation Weight defaulted from Part Master.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOperRow.WeightUOM
member.summary: Operation Weight UOM defaulted from Part Master.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOperRow.SendAheadType
member.summary:
Determines the scheduling offset for the secondary start-to-start operation, offset which will be either
calculated (or entered) on the primary operation. The offset time can be calculated by pieces, percentage
of the operation duration or entered manually by the user on the primary operation. The secondary operation
will scheduled to start after the offset period.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOperRow.SendAheadOffset
member.summary:
Scheduling offset for the secondary start-to-start operation. The offset time can be calculated by pieces,
percentage of the operation duration or entered manually by the user on the primary operation. The
secondary operation will scheduled to start after the offset period.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOperRow.PrjRoleList
member.summary: Delimited list of PrjRoleCd codes that are allowed for this operation.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOperRow.TearDwnEndDate
member.summary: Scheduled tear down start date. The start date would be the production end date.

member.summary: Scheduled tear down due hour offset from the end of the prodution time. This field is established by scheduling.

member.summary: Scheduled tear down start date. The start date would be the production end date.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOperRow.WITearDwnEndHour
member.summary: Scheduled tear down due hour offset from the end of the prodution time. This field is established by scheduling.

member.summary: For non subconctract operations JobOper.EstSetHours * JobOper.SetupBurRate + JobOper.EstProdHours * JobOper.ProdBurRate

member.summary: For non subcontract operations : JobOper.EstSetHours * JobOper.SetupCrewSize * JobOper.SetupLabRate +JobOper.EstProdHours * JobOper.ProdCrewSize * JobOper.ProdLabRate

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOpDtlRow.OprSeq
member.summary: A sequence number which uniquely identifies the JobOper record within the JobAsmbl. System assigned.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOpDtlRow.OpDtlSeq
member.summary: Uniquely identifies an OpDtl. System assigned.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOpDtlRow.SetupOrProd
member.summary: Identifies which part of the production, setup or production, the resource is required for. Valid values are "S", indicating the resource is RequiredFor the Setup phase of this operation, "P" for Production phase, or "B" meaning Both setup and production phase.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOpDtlRow.CapabilityID
member.summary: The user can select the capability the operation is to perform. The system will select the resource.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOpDtlRow.ResourceGrpID
member.summary: The user can select a Resource Group for the operation to be performed on. The system will select the actual resource.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOpDtlRow.ResourceID
member.summary: Descriptive code assigned by the user to uniquely identify the Resource for this operation to be performed on. If a resource was not explicitly assigned this field is blank.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOpDtlRow.ConcurrentCapacity
member.summary: Concurrent Capacity is a constraint that prevents a Resource from being overloaded because it has, at a given time, this much capacity. For example, a Resource has 4 racks, and they can be reused, but once they've been selected for an operation, they're tied up until the operation is complete.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOpDtlRow.DailyProdRate
member.summary: The Daily Prod rate contains the rate required to make 1. This is multiplied with the mfg qty of the job to get the total production qty. This total is then compared to the resource's daily production quantity and with any usage stored in the Shopload record. Once the production limit for a resource has been reached, the Resource has been consumed for that day.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOpDtlRow.NumResources
member.summary: This is the number of resources the operation can run on. If multiple resources can perform the required Capability, then up to this many will be employed. This determines the number of setups the system will allow for the operation. However, the number of setups cannot exceed the number of operations. The idea being that once a part is on a machine you will complete the operation on that resource.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOpDtlRow.EstSetHours
member.summary: Total estimated set up hours. Calculated as EstSetHoursPerMch * Machines. It is set to zero if operation qty is zero. This is maintained via the JobOper write trigger.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOpDtlRow.EstProdHours
member.summary: The estimated Production run hours for internal operations (JobOper.Subcontract = No) . This is not directly maintainable. It exists so that it will be easier to display than always having to recalculate it when it is needed. It is calculated using the ProdStandard, StdFormat, StdBasis, OpsPerPart, QtyPer, EstScrap and EstScrapType. FORMULAS: If StdFormat = "HR" then EstProdHours = ProdStandard. If StdFormat = "PH" then (JobOper.RunQty / Std). If StdFormat = "PM" then (JobOper.RunQty / Std ) / 60. If StdFormat = "OH" then (JobOper.RunQty/OpsPerPart) / Std. If StdFormat = "OM" then ((JobOper.RunQty/OpsPerPart) / Std) / 60. If StdFormat = "HP" then (JobOPer.RunQty/Basis) X Std. If StdFormat = "MP" then ((JobOper.RunQty/Basis) X Std) / 60.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOpDtlRow.ProdStandard
member.summary: The production standard for the operation. It can be expressed as Hours, Minutes per piece, Pieces per Time, Operations per Minute or Operations per hour. This along with the StdFormat, StdBasis, OpsPer and fields are used to calculate the operations estimated production hours. A value can be defaulted from the OpStd master. NOTE: The ProdStandard can only be zero if the EstSetHours are greater than zero.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOpDtlRow.StdFormat
member.summary: Qualifier for the Production Standard field. This is used as a default to the qualifier field in operation details. The valid qualifiers are; "HP" - Hours/Piece, "MP" - minutes/piece, "PH" - pieces/hour, "PM" - Pieces/Minute, "OH" - Operations/Hour, "OM" - Operations/minute, HR - Fixed Hours.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOpDtlRow.StdBasis
member.summary: A standard basis is to be used to with standards that are time per piece (HP & MP). The basis is a Divisor. Valid codes are E-Eaches, C=100's, M=1000's, T=10,000. This field is used in the formula for calculating the estimated production hours. The operation quantity is divided by the basis value and then multiplied by the standard to result in hours.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOpDtlRow.OpsPerPart
member.summary: Number of operations per part. This is used in the calculation of the estimated production hours when the StdFormat is "OM" or "OH". This should not be accessible if StdFormat is not "OM" or "OH". It MUST BE > 0 if StdFormat is "OM" or "OH".

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOpDtlRow.ProdLabRate
member.summary: Labor rate used for estimated production labor costs. Default from the OpMasDtl.ProdLabRate.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOpDtlRow.SetupLabRate
member.summary: Labor rate for estimated setup labor costs. Default from the OpMaster.SetupLabRate.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOpDtlRow.ProdBurRate
member.summary: The burden rate to be used for the production time on this operation. (EstProdHrs X ProdBurRate). Default from the WrkCenter.ProdBurRate.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOpDtlRow.SetupBurRate
member.summary: The burden rate to be used for the Setup time on this operation. (EstSetHours X ProdBurRate). Default from the WrkCenter.SetupBurRate.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOpDtlRow.ProdComplete
member.summary: A flag indicating if the production is complete for this operation. It is updated via Labor Entry.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOpDtlRow.SetupComplete
member.summary: Flag that indicates if Setup is complete on this operation. This flag is only used when the operation has EstSetupHours > 0.00.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOpDtlRow.ActProdHours
member.summary: Total Actual Production Hours. A summary of non-setup LaborDtl.BurdenHrs. This includes REWORK hours. This is maintained via write/delete triggers on the LaborDtl file. Along with JobOper.ActReworkHours it is used to reduce the shop load if the system is configured to remove load by actual hours (JCSyst.RemoveLoad = "H").

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOpDtlRow.ActProdRwkHours
member.summary: Total Actual Production Rework Hours. A summary of rework labor transactions (LaborDtl.BurdenHrs) where LaborDtl.LaborType = "P" and Rework = Yes. This number is also included as part of the JobOPer.ActProdHours. Maintained via write/delete triggers on the LaborDtl file. Along with JobOper.ActProdHours it is used to reduce the shop load if the system is configured to remove load by actual hours (JCSyst.RemoveLoad = "H"). (See the lib/inopload.i code for load remaining logic)

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOpDtlRow.ActSetupHours
member.summary: Actual setup hours. A summary of setup (LaborDtl.LaborType = S) labor transactions hours (LaborDtl.Burden). Actual Setup hours reduce the shop load if the system is configured to remove load based on hours (JCSyst.RemoveLoad = "H").

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOpDtlRow.ActSetupRwkHours
member.summary: Total Actual Setup Rework Hours. A summary of rework labor transactions (LaborDtl.BurdenHrs) where LaborDtl.LaborType = "S" and Rework = Yes. This number is also included as part of the JobOPer.ActSetupHours. Maintained via write/delete triggers on the LaborDtl file. Along with JobOper.ActSetHours it is used to reduce the shop load if the system is configured to remove load by actual hours (JCSyst.RemoveLoad = "H"). (See the lib/inopload.i code for load remaining logic)

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOpDtlRow.SetupPctComplete
member.summary: Setup function percent complete. Maintained via labor entry.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOpDtlRow.ActBurCost
member.summary: Total Burden cost to date. This is update via the LaborDtl\Write.p trigger procedure. It includes ALL burden costs (Setup, Production and Rework)

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOpDtlRow.ActLabCost
member.summary: Total of ALL labor costs to date. This includes Setup, Production and Rework. Updated via the LaborDtl.Write.p trigger. The Total Cost, updated via the receipt process.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOpDtlRow.ReworkBurCost
member.summary: Total Rework Burden cost todate. This value is also included in the ActBurCost total. It includes both setup & production rework. Updated via LaborDtl\Write.P trigger.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOpDtlRow.ReworkLabCost
member.summary: Total Rework Labor cost to date. This value is also included in the ActLabCost field. This includes both Setup and Production. Updated via the LaborDtl\Write.p trigger.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOpDtlRow.ResourceLock
member.summary: Resource Lock. If the user explicitly selected a Resource for the JobOpDtl, when they accept the scheduling changes, the WISchedResource will be stored as the explicit Resource. Else the WISchedResource will become the SchedResource and the WISchedResourceGrp will become the ResourceGroup.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOpDtlRow.SysCreateDate
member.summary: System maintained. Date the JobOpDtl record was added to the database.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOpDtlRow.SysCreateTime
member.summary: Time in seconds since midnight that the system created the record.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOpDtlRow.OpDtlDesc
member.summary: Description is initially created when the JobOpDtl is created. If the JobOpDtl is created from a Resource it will be the Resource.Description, if it's created from an ResourceGroup it will be the ResourceGroup.Description. Once set it is not changed by the system.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOpDtlRow.EstSetHoursPerMch
member.summary: The estimated set up hours per machine. Default from OpStd.SetupHours. Used to calculate JobOper.EstSetupHours.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOpDtlRow.OverrideRates
member.summary: If yes then the user has overridden the rates that were on the record when it was inititally created. The initial rates came from the master files.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOpDtlRow.ProdCrewSize
member.summary: Duplicated from JobOper.SetupCrewSize. The # of people it physically takes to perform the production on this operation per machine that it is run on. CrewSize * JobOper.EstProdHours = Est. Prod. Labor Hours. Note this can be a fraction for operations that do not require full time attention of an employee. See also SetUpCrewSize

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOpDtlRow.SetUpCrewSize
member.summary: Duplicated from JobOper.SetupCrewSize. Its the number of people it physically takes to setup this operation. It is used as a multiplier in the estimated labor hours calculation. JobOper.EstSetHours * JobOper.SetUpCrewSize = Estimated Labor hours for the operation. This also affects the estimated labor cost. Est Cost = Est Labor Hours * SetUpLaborRate

member.summary: Assembly Sequence # that this Operation is associated with.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOperRestrictionRow.OprSeq
member.summary: A sequence number which uniquely identifies the operation record within the Job/lot/level. The sequence can be system generated or assigned by user. System generated numbers are determined by reading last JobOper for the job/lot/level and then figures out what the next number that is divisible by 10. If this number is within 3 of the last Number on file it will be bumped up another 10. This keeps a minimum of 2 available sequences between records. For example if last = 18 Next would be 30, If last = 17 next = 20.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOperRestrictionRow.RestrictionTypeID
member.summary: Restriction Type identification.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOperRestrictionRow.OpCode
member.summary: Descriptive code assigned by user which uniquely identifies a Operation master record. Can't be blank. This is used as a foreign key in other files and may be used in displays/reports where space for the full description is limited.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobOperRestrictionRow.Manual
member.summary: When true then no roll-up will be calculated for this Restriction type. Compliance date is set when this flag is set. D/I Roll-Up radio Button will be disabled.

member.summary: When true then no roll-up will be calculated for this Restriction type. Compliance date is set when this flag is set. D/I Roll-Up radio Button will be disabled.

member.summary: Enabled when manual flag is unchecked and company configuration flag for allow direct roll-up is enabled. Default to Indirect Roll-Up.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobAsmblRestrictionRow.Compliance
member.summary: Displays one of the compliance statuses: 1. Not applicable (Yellow) (when no substances are selected) 2. Non compliant (Red) (one or more substances are selected but roll-up has not been executed or roll-up has failed) 3. Compliant (Green) (one or more substances are selected and roll-up was successful) 4. Exempt (Yellow) (when all substances are exempt ? verify exempt date)

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobAsmblRestrictionRow.ComplianceDate
member.summary: Set when Manual flag is checked or after compliance roll-up is successful. Cleared Manual flag is unchecked or after compliance roll-up is unsuccessful.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobAsmblRestrictionRow.LastRollUp
member.summary: Set after compliance roll-up

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobAsmblRestrictionRow.BuiltCompliance
member.summary: Displays one of the built compliance statuses: 1. Not applicable (Yellow) (when no substances are selected) 2. Non compliant (Red) (one or more substances are selected but roll-up has not been executed or roll-up has failed) 3. Compliant (Green) (one or more substances are selected and roll-up was successful) 4. Exempt (Yellow) (when all substances are exempt ? verify exempt date)

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobAsmblRestrictionRow.BuiltComplianceDate
member.summary: Set when Manual flag is checked or after built compliance roll-up is successful. Cleared Manual flag is unchecked or after compliance roll-up is unsuccessful.

member.summary: RowMod

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobAuditRow.SpecifiedProperties
member.summary: SpecifiedProperties

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobPartRow.Company
member.summary: Company Identifier.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobPartRow.JobNum
member.summary: Job Number. Used in tying record back to its parent JobHead record.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobPartRow.PartNum
member.summary: Part number of the manufactured item. Does not have to be valid in the Part master. Cannot be blank. With verion 8.0 and Advanced Production License a job can have multiple end parts. These are defined in the JobPart table. This field has not changed. But will now be used to indicate the primary end part that is being produced. That is, the JobPart record where JobPart.PartNum = JobHead.PartNum will be considered as the primary end part. A primary part is only significant on Concurrent mode of production, because it?s quantity drives the material/operation requirements.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobPartRow.RevisionNum
member.summary: Part Revision number. Defaults from the most current PartRev.RevisionNum.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobPartRow.PartsPerOp
member.summary: Part Per Operation. Active only for Concurrent process Jobs. Otherwise set to 1.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobPartRow.PartQty
member.summary: The number of individual parts that are being produced part. Sum of all related JobProd.ProdQty. Not Directly maintable.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobPartRow.StockQty
member.summary: Part Qty that is being produced for Stock.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobPartRow.ShippedQty
member.summary: Total Quantity of the end part shipped from this job. Updated via the ShipDtl write triggers.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobPartRow.ReceivedQty
member.summary: Total quantity received to stock for the end part of the Job. Updated via the Manufacturing receipts process.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobPartRow.WIPQty
member.summary: Represents the "outstanding" WIP of production quantity. A summary of JobProd.WIPQty, updated via JobProd write trigger.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobPartRow.QtyCompleted
member.summary: Part Production quantity completed. Updated via JobOper write trigger or LaborPart trigger. If JobOper is the "Final Operation" (see JobAsmbl.FinalOpr) then this is set equal to JobOper.QtyCompleted.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobPartRow.ReservedQty
member.summary: Quantity of the job completed quantity that is "Reserved" for the linked demands (sales orders/other jobs). Summary of PartAlloc.ReservedQty where PartAlloc.SupplyJobNum = JobHead.JobNum. Reservations for Orders are made via the Order Allocations program. They are excluded from available quantity calculations for the job. Available Quantity = JobHead.QtyCompleted - (Shipped + Received to stk + ReservedAllocQty + PickingQty + PickedQty). Maintained via PartAlloc write trigger.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobPartRow.AllocatedQty900
member.summary: Total Allocated Quantity for this job part

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobPartRow.PickingQty
member.summary: Quantity of the job completed quantity that is considered as in the "Picking" process for the linked sales orders. Summary of PartAlloc.PickingQty where PartAlloc.SupplyJobNum = JobHead.JobNum. PickingQty is set in the Order Allocation program. Maintained via PartAlloc write trigger.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobPartRow.PickedQty
member.summary: Quantity of the job completed quantity that is considered as in the shipping "Staging" process for the linked sales orders. Summary of PartAlloc.PickedQty where PartAlloc.SupplyJobNum = JobHead.JobNum. PickedQty is updated when the material move moves the item to the staging area. Maintained via PartAlloc write trigger.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobPartRow.LbrCostBase
member.summary: Defines an integer value which is used to calculate a ratio for prorating the labor costs to the end part. For example a job produces parts A and B, and you want part B to have cost 2 times that of the cost of Part A. Part A CostBase would be 1 and B would be 2.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobPartRow.MtlCostBase
member.summary: Defines an integer value which is used to calculate a ratio for prorating the material costs to the end part. For example a job produces parts A and B, and you want part B to have cost 2 times that of the cost of Part A. Part A CostBase would be 1 and B would be 2.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobPartRow.JobClosed
member.summary: Indicates if Job is closed. Mirror image of JobHead.JobClosed. Duplicated for performance reasons

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobPartRow.JobComplete
member.summary: Indicates if production is complete for the job. Mirror image of JobHead.JobClosed. Duplicated for performance reasons

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobPartRow.Plant
member.summary: Site Identifier. Mirror image of JobHead.Site. Duplicated for performance reasons

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobPartRow.PartDescription
member.summary: Describes the Part.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobPartRow.IUM
member.summary: Defines the Unit of Measure used when part is issued, this is also how it is stocked. Use the value from XaSyst.UM as a default when creating new part records.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobPartRow.ShipDocReq
member.summary: Shipping Documents Required. Indicates if shipping documents are required when shipping this part from the Job. Pertains to Job Shipments only and only if the PartNum does not exist in the PartTable. If it does exist then the Part.ShipDocReq. If checked, then at the time of shipping the system will require that the JobPart.ShipDocsAvail flag is true before allowing the shipment.Requires DocManagement license.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobPartRow.ShipDocAvail
member.summary: Required Shipping Documents Available. A flag manually set by the user to indicate that the required documents for the Job Part are available. In order to set to Yes, at least one attachment having a DocType with Shipment = yes must exist for the Job Part. If the Part.ShipDocReq = yes then JobPart.ShipDocsA vail must = yes before the system will allow shipment of the Part from the job.Requires DocManagement license.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobPartRow.MtlList
member.summary: List of materials that us this part as cost base

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobPartRow.PreventSugg
member.summary: Indicates that MRP should not create job suggestions for the specified co-part

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobPartRow.SysRevID
member.summary: Revision identifier for this row. It is incremented upon each write.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobPartRow.SysRowID
member.summary: Unique identifier for this row. The value is a GUID.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobPartRow.ProcessMode
member.summary: The value of the JobHead.ProcessMode

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobPartRow.EnableShipDocReq
member.summary: Indicates if ShipDocReq is enabled. Only if JobPart.PartNum does not exist in Part Table and if Document Management is installed.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobPartRow.PartmasterPart
member.summary: Logical field signifying whether JobPart.PartNum is a valid part master part.

member.summary: RowMod

member.summary: SpecifiedProperties

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobProdRow.Company
member.summary: Company Identifier.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobProdRow.JobNum
member.summary: Job Number. Used in tying record back to its parent JobHead record.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobProdRow.OrderNum
member.summary: Related sales order number. For build to stock demands the OrderNum, OrderLine and OrderRel fields are all zero

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobProdRow.OrderLine
member.summary: Related Sales order line number.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobProdRow.OrderRelNum
member.summary: Related sales order release number.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobProdRow.ProdQty
member.summary: The planned production quantity for a Job to fill the demand. Note: updates the JobHead.ProdQty via JobProd write trigger.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobProdRow.WarehouseCode
member.summary: Inventory warehouse that job is producing for. Only relevant for build to stock demands (ordernum = 0). In this case a valid Part must be referenced.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobProdRow.TargetJobNum
member.summary: Production Demands can be from other jobs. That is, one job can be building parts that are required by another job. The demand is defined by a JobMtl record on some other job. "TargetJobNum" is the job that this job is making parts for.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobProdRow.TargetAssemblySeq
member.summary: Assembly Sequence of the JobMtl record that is making the production demand. (See "TargetJobNum")

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobProdRow.TargetMtlSeq
member.summary: Material Sequence of the JobMtl record that is making the production demand. (See "TargetJobNum")

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobProdRow.ShippedQty
member.summary: Quantity Shipped against this allocation. Updated via the ShipDtl write triggers.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobProdRow.ReceivedQty
member.summary: Total quantity received to stock for this production allocation. Updated via the Manufacturing Receipts process

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobProdRow.WIPQty
member.summary: Represents the "outstanding" WIP production quantity. WIPQty = JobProd.Quantity - (ShippedQty +ReceivedQty) if negative then it is set to zero. If related Order Release is closed then reservation is zero. Updated via the JobProd, OrderRel triggers.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobProdRow.CallNum
member.summary: The Service Call number that this Job is linked to.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobProdRow.CallLine
member.summary: The Service Call Line that this Job is linked to.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobProdRow.TFLineNum
member.summary: This is the unique key for this table. It will have a prefix like Job to indicate firm or unfirm orders. The record can be linked to an Order Header by using the TFOrdNum TFOrdSeq keys.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobProdRow.PartNum
member.summary: Part number of the manufactured item. Does not have to be valid in the Part master. Cannot be blank. With verion 8.0 and Advanced Production License a job can have multiple end parts. These are defined in the JobPart table. This field has not changed. But will now be used to indicate the primary end part that is being produced. That is, the JobPart record where JobPart.PartNum = JobHead.PartNum will be considered as the primary end part. A primary part is only significant on Concurrent mode of production, because it?s quantity drives the material/operation requirements.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobProdRow.Plant
member.summary: Site Identifier.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobProdRow.DemandContractNum
member.summary: The demand contract this demand schedule is for.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobProdRow.DemandHeadSeq
member.summary: The sequence from the DemandHead record this DemandSchedule is related to.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobProdRow.DemandDtlSeq
member.summary: The sequence from the DemandDetail record this DemandSchedule is related to.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobProdRow.DemandScheduleSeq
member.summary: This field along with Company, DemandContractNum, DemandHeadSeq, and DemandDetailSeq make up the unique key to the table. The system should generate this number during entry of new detail records. The system determines next available number by finding the last DemandSchedulel record for the DemandDetail and the adding 1 to it.

member.summary: Temp field so UI has a column to bind to for calculation of Total Split Quantity.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobProdRow.Valid
member.summary: This is a field used in Split Job to determine if record has been validated.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobHeadListRow.Company
member.summary: Company Identifier.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobHeadListRow.JobClosed
member.summary: Indicates if Job is closed. A closed Job cannot be accessed for maintenance.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobHeadListRow.ClosedDate
member.summary: Date the Job was closed. Defaults as the system but can be overridden.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobHeadListRow.JobComplete
member.summary: Indicates if production is complete for the job. A complete job cannot be scheduled. It can still have cost posted against it. Maintained via Job Completion processing.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobHeadListRow.JobCompletionDate
member.summary: The date that production was completed for this Job. Maintained via Job Completion Processing.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobHeadListRow.JobEngineered
member.summary: Indicates if Engineering is complete for this job. That is, all departments that need to "check off" on this job before it is actually considered ready to go have done so. A job must be Engineered before it can be scheduled. Non Engineered Jobs are excluded from most reports.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobHeadListRow.JobReleased
member.summary: Indicates if job has been "Released" to production. Only jobs that are released can have labor posted against them. Once labor is posted to a Job this flag cannot be changed.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobHeadListRow.JobHeld
member.summary: Indicates if the Job has been placed on "HOLD". Currently this field is only used for display purposes. It may be used later to prevent or provide warnings and messages in appropriate areas such as Shipping, Purchasing, Labor processing, etc.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobHeadListRow.JobNum
member.summary: Job number. Unique key to identify the production job. When adding "new" records and this is left blank the system will assign a job number. Assigning numbers will be done by using a "database" sequence number. Then using that number loop and increment until an available number is found.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobHeadListRow.PartNum
member.summary: Part number of the manufactured item. Does not have to be valid in the Part master. Cannot be blank. With verion 8.0 and Advanced Production License a job can have multiple end parts. These are defined in the JobPart table. This field has not changed. But will now be used to indicate the primary end part that is being produced. That is, the JobPart record where JobPart.PartNum = JobHead.PartNum will be considered as the primary end part. A primary part is only significant on Concurrent mode of production, because it?s quantity drives the material/operation requirements.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobHeadListRow.RevisionNum
member.summary: Part Revision number. Defaults from the most current PartRev.RevisionNum.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobHeadListRow.DrawNum
member.summary: Engineering Drawing Number. An optional field. Defaulted from BomHead.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobHeadListRow.PartDescription
member.summary: The description of the part that is to be manufactured. Use the Part.Description as the default.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobHeadListRow.ProdQty
member.summary: This field is not directly maintainable. The value stored here will be different than it was in the pre 8.0- versions. If ProcessMode is Sequential then this is a total of ALL end parts that are being produced on the job. If Concurrent then it is the production quantity of the primary part /PartsPerOp . For example 1000 bottle caps are require, 100 caps are produced per machine cycle would result in ProdQty of 10. See JobPart table for information on end parts of a job.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobHeadListRow.IUM
member.summary: The unit of measure for the job. Defaulted from Part.IUM.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobHeadListRow.StartDate
member.summary: The Scheduled job start date (including queue time). This is not directly user maintainable. It is calculated/updated via the scheduling functions

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobHeadListRow.StartHour
member.summary: This field is established by scheduling. It represents the "Hour offset from the beginning of the work day" when this job is scheduled to begin (including queue time).

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobHeadListRow.DueDate
member.summary: Scheduled finish date for the entire Job (including move time). This is not user maintainable. It is updated via the scheduling process.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobHeadListRow.DueHour
member.summary: This field is established by scheduling. It represents the "Hour offset from the beginning of the work day" when this job is scheduled to end (including move time).

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobHeadListRow.ReqDueDate
member.summary: Indicates the date at which this job needs to be completed. This is maintainable by the user. It can be defaulted as the earliest due date of the linked orders. This due date is used as the default date for "backward" scheduling of the job.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobHeadListRow.JobCode
member.summary: An optional user defined code. This will be used for report selections and views of job headers.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobHeadListRow.QuoteNum
member.summary: Contains the Quote number reference. This was assigned when the job details were pulled in from the quote. It will be used to show quote figures compared to estimated and actual.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobHeadListRow.QuoteLine
member.summary: Contains the quote line number reference. (see QuoteNum )

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobHeadListRow.ProdCode
member.summary: Product Group Code. Use the Part.ProdCode as a default. This can be blank or must be valid in the ProdGrup table.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobHeadListRow.ExpenseCode
member.summary: The default override expense code that will be used for all labor reported against this job. When this is entered then it will override all over default logic for developing the default G/L expense account in labor entry. This can be blank or must be valid in the LabExpCd master file.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobHeadListRow.InCopyList
member.summary: Indicates if the final assembly is to be included in the browse of assemblies in the "get details" function. The user can use to option to keep the "Copy from" list from becoming cluttered with too many assemblies. This does not prevent the user from copying this assembly it just keeps it out of the browse.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobHeadListRow.WIName
member.summary: This field is blank or contains the UserID. When not blank it indicates that some or all the operations of this job are in a "What if" scheduling mode. In this condition the scheduling board prevents other users from modifying any operations on this job until the changes get committed. This field is also used as part of an index which allows the system to quickly find the operations that need to be reset to "Actual Schedule".

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobHeadListRow.WIStartDate
member.summary: The Scheduled "What If" job start date (including queue time). This is not directly user maintainable. It is calculated/updated via the scheduling functions

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobHeadListRow.WIStartHour
member.summary: This field is established by scheduling. It represents the What-If "Hour offset from the beginning of the work day" when this job is scheduled to begin (including queue time).

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobHeadListRow.Candidate
member.summary: Indicates if the system considers this Job as a candidate for the completion process. Jobs that are marked as JobClosed = No, JobComplete = No and Candidate = Yes can be viewed in the Job Completion/Closing program by selecting the Candidates option. This field is not directly maintainable. It is set to based on the value of JobOper.OpComplete of the last operation of the final assembly.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobHeadListRow.SchedCode
member.summary: Scheduling Code. SchedCode references a record in the SchedPri table.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobHeadListRow.SchedLocked
member.summary: If yes the Jobs' schedule is locked, and not affected by the SchedCode. Locked jobs are allocated (and over-allocated) machine time before any non-locked jobs are scheduled.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobHeadListRow.ProjectID
member.summary: Associates the JobHead with a project in the Project table. This can be blank.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobHeadListRow.WIPCleared
member.summary: For closed jobs (JobHead.JobClosed = yes) this indicates if all of the costs on this job have been removed from WIP. Costs are moved out of WIP during the "Generate WIP transactions" process.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobHeadListRow.JobFirm
member.summary: A flag which controls whether or not the MRP process can make changes to this job. MRP can only make changes when JobFirm = No.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobHeadListRow.PersonList
member.summary: A LIST-DELIM delimited list of people.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobHeadListRow.PersonID
member.summary: Identifies the Person to be used as the Production Planner. This person is responsible for handling the manufacturing suggestions to this job. Manufacturing suggestions can be filtered by Planner. Relates to the Person table. Defaults from the ProdGrup.PersonID.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobHeadListRow.ProdTeamID
member.summary: Production Team for the Job. Associates the JobHead with a ProdTeam.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobHeadListRow.QtyCompleted
member.summary: Production quantity completed. Updated via JobOper write trigger. If JobOper is the "Final Operation" (see JobAsmbl.FinalOpr) then this is set equal to JobOper.QtyCompleted.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobHeadListRow.Plant
member.summary: Site Identifier.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobHeadListRow.DatePurged
member.summary: The date the detail for the Job was purged. The detail is the LaborDtl, PartTrans, and JobOpMac records associated with the job. Once details have been purged the job cannot be reopened. A job must be closed for it to be purged.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobHeadListRow.TravelerReadyToPrint
member.summary: Indicates if the Traveler can be printed. Print functions are not available if this is = No.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobHeadListRow.StatusReadyToPrint
member.summary: Indicates if the Status can be printed. Print functions are not available if this is = No.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobHeadListRow.CallNum
member.summary: The Service Call number that this Job is linked to.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobHeadListRow.CallLine
member.summary: The Service Call Line that this Job is linked to.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobHeadListRow.JobType
member.summary: Describe the type of job this is: MFG = Manufacturing, MNT = Maintenance, PRJ = Project, SRV = Service

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobHeadListRow.PhaseID
member.summary: Project Phase ID

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobHeadListRow.AnalysisCode
member.summary: Analysis Code

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobHeadListRow.HDCaseNum
member.summary: The help desk case that created this job.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobHeadListRow.EquipID
member.summary: The ID of the Equipment that this "Maintenance Job" is for. Foreign key component to Equip table.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobHeadListRow.PlanNum
member.summary: Preventive Maintenance Plan Number that this "Maintenance Job" is for. Foreign key component to EquipPlan table. Note: A Maintenance Job does not have to be for a Preventive Maintenance plan, in which case this is zero. If time based plan, then the closing process will update the EquipPlan.NextDate. Therefore, the Job must know the EquipID and PlanNum in order to do this.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobHeadListRow.IssueTopicID1
member.summary: Maintenance Issue Topic 1. Pertinent to maint jobs only. (JobType = "MNT") Foreign Key to HDTopic table. Must be a top level topic (HDTopic.TopLevel = Yes) and HDTopic.MaintIssue = Yes

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobHeadListRow.ExternalMES
member.summary: Indicates the record is used with Machine MES

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobHeadListRow.SysRowID
member.summary: Unique identifier for this row. The value is a GUID.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobHeadListRow.PartNumPartDescription
member.summary: Part Description

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobHeadListRow.PartNumTrackDimension
member.summary: Track Dimension

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobHeadListRow.PartNumTrackLots
member.summary: Track Lots

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobHeadListRow.PartNumTrackSerialNum
member.summary: Track Serial Num

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobHeadListRow.PMJob
member.summary: Relative to Maintenance Jobs (JobType = "MNT") indicates if job is for "Preventive Maintenance". This is a job that was created for a Equipment Maintenance Plan (JobHead.PlanNum > 0)

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobHeadListRow.SmartString
member.summary: Original smart string passed in for configuration

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JobHeadListRow.SmartStringProcessed
member.summary: If TRUE then this field will mean that the smart string has already been processed
